2017-11-10.abstract: In our Travel issue, we pay homage to the many ways — sight included — that we come to understand a nation, a town, a culture.
2017-11-10.snippet: In our Travel issue, we pay homage to the many ways — sight included — that we come to understand a nation, a town, a culture.
2017-11-10.lead_paragraph: Nagisa Oshima’s 1976 film, “In the Realm of the Senses,” is a febrile sadomasochistic romp that ends with the female protagonist lopping off her lover’s genitals and carrying them around with her. The movie is widely considered a classic of contemporary Japanese erotica, but it has always been remarkable to me for its title alone, which seems a perfect expression of the sensations we encounter when we travel somewhere foreign. It’s hardly original to assert that of all the ways we experience place, sight is perhaps the least important; the thing that convinces me I’m actually in Japan, for example, is never the slur of neon outside the Tokyo-bound train’s windows, but the perfume of soy sauce, cooking oil and burning cedar that is particular to the country. The same is true with Delhi: You step through the airport doors, and there it is — singed rubber, wet concrete, damp loam, roasting cardamom. These days, thanks to the ongoing globalization (or democratization, depending on your perspective) of fashion and music, many cities can look, and sound, very much alike. But a place’s fragrance is inimitable, a visceral biography of its cuisine, places of worship and landscape.
2017-11-10.headline_main: T’s Travel Issue: Editor’s Letter

2017-11-10.abstract: Equifax has reported more than $87 million in expenses related to the huge data breach it announced in September. And there will be more costs to come.
2017-11-10.snippet: Equifax has reported more than $87 million in expenses related to the huge data breach it announced in September. And there will be more costs to come.
2017-11-10.lead_paragraph: Equifax has suffered a new intrusion — into its profitability. Costs relating to the consumer credit reporting agency’s major cyberattack helped knock earnings down 27 percent in the third quarter from a year earlier. Revenue also took a big hit. And the likely biggest expenses — including a long list of unquantified legal exposures — are yet to rain down.
2017-11-10.headline_main: Cyberattack Casts a Long Shadow on Equifax’s Earnings

2017-11-10.abstract: Bruce Dickinson of Iron Maiden has written a memoir as far-ranging as he is, “What Does This Button Do?”
2017-11-10.snippet: Bruce Dickinson of Iron Maiden has written a memoir as far-ranging as he is, “What Does This Button Do?”
2017-11-10.lead_paragraph: EN GARDE: Bruce Dickinson, the amateur fencer and home-brewing commercial pilot who has — incidentally — also spent some 40 years as lead singer of the heavy-metal band Iron Maiden, can add best-selling memoirist to his résumé: “What Does This Button Do?” hits the hardcover nonfiction list at No. 10. Reviewing the book in The Times of London, Will Hodgkinson noted that Iron Maiden’s hits “are essentially pop songs, albeit ones with squealing guitars and vocals from a man who sounded as if his testicles were snagged on a fence.” That would be Dickinson, whom Hodgkinson goes on to describe in more detail: “An everyman in Spandex who was at once relatable and fantastical, he perfected a howl of glory while sporting the look of a codpieced medieval knight on a trip to the disco. Stardom was inevitable.”
2017-11-10.headline_main: Meet the Sword-Fighting, Home-Brewing, Airplane-Flying Heavy-Metal Singer

2017-11-10.abstract: T asked three chefs to reflect on meals that speak to their experience growing up with two cultures.
2017-11-10.snippet: T asked three chefs to reflect on meals that speak to their experience growing up with two cultures.
2017-11-10.lead_paragraph: American chefs of Asian descent are changing the way we eat, reclaiming the ingredients and flavors of their childhoods and making of them a new cuisine. We asked three to share recipes that speak to their experience of growing up in two cultures: Angela Dimayuga, the daughter of Filipino immigrants and, until recently, executive chef of the eclectic Mission Chinese Food in New York; Diep Tran, the owner of Good Girl Dinette, a Vietnamese diner in Highland Park, Los Angeles, whose family came to the U.S. as refugees from Saigon; and the Korean-born Deuki Hong, who spent his childhood in Texas, Alabama and New Jersey and now runs the Korean fried-chicken pop-up Sunday Bird in the back of a bubble-tea shop in San Francisco.
2017-11-10.headline_main: Three Asian-American Chefs Share Recipes for Meaningful Dishes

2017-11-10.abstract: A woman faces murder and arson charges after a fire killed two of her neighbors.
2017-11-10.snippet: A woman faces murder and arson charges after a fire killed two of her neighbors.
2017-11-10.lead_paragraph: A woman accused of starting a fire that killed two people in her Brooklyn apartment building this week told detectives she lit the fire because she was angry that garbage had been left in the hallway, officials said.
2017-11-10.headline_main: Woman Charged in Deadly Fire Said She Was Angry Over Trash, Officials Said

2017-11-10.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-11-10.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-11-10.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2017-11-10.headline_main: Roy Moore, Lebanon, Louis C.K.: Your Friday Evening Briefing

2017-11-10.abstract: Two new books offer startlingly different conclusions on Silicon Valley’s influence on our economy, culture and politics.
2017-11-10.snippet: Two new books offer startlingly different conclusions on Silicon Valley’s influence on our economy, culture and politics.
2017-11-10.lead_paragraph: The pervasive influence of Silicon Valley on our economy, culture and politics is a subject worthy of close study. Two important new books released this week offer startlingly different approaches and conclusions on these complex issues. The contrasting epigraphs that begin the works perfectly reflect their respective perspectives.
2017-11-10.headline_main: Review: Two Contrasting Views of Silicon Valley’s Influence

2017-11-10.abstract: Mr. De Cormier had a musical double life, as a choral director and composer and as an arranger for the likes of Harry Belafonte and Peter, Paul and Mary.
2017-11-10.snippet: Mr. De Cormier had a musical double life, as a choral director and composer and as an arranger for the likes of Harry Belafonte and Peter, Paul and Mary.
2017-11-10.lead_paragraph: Robert De Cormier, who led a musical double life as a choral director and composer in classical music and an arranger and a conductor for folk and pop stars like Harry Belafonte and Peter, Paul and Mary, died on Nov. 7 in Rutland, Vt. He was 95.
2017-11-10.headline_main: Robert De Cormier, Arranger for Folk and Pop Stars, Dies at 95

2017-11-10.abstract: The utility failed to make a payment within the grace period, and similar deadlines loom on securities issued by the government and state enterprises.
2017-11-10.snippet: The utility failed to make a payment within the grace period, and similar deadlines loom on securities issued by the government and state enterprises.
2017-11-10.lead_paragraph: Venezuela showed new signs of a financial unraveling on Friday, as the state electricity company was declared in default.
2017-11-10.headline_main: Venezuelan Debt Crisis Widens, With Power Company in Default

2017-11-11.abstract: The shopping extravaganza — China’s version of Black Friday and Amazon’s Prime Day — was a test of logistics networks and retail innovations.
2017-11-11.snippet: The shopping extravaganza — China’s version of Black Friday and Amazon’s Prime Day — was a test of logistics networks and retail innovations.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Singles Day — the frenzied annual celebration of consumption and commerce that is China’s much larger version of Black Friday — began as a protest of sorts against Valentine’s Day, propelled by college students in the 1990s.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Alibaba’s Singles Day Sales Hit New Record of $25.3 Billion

2017-11-11.abstract: In an upper-middle-class suburb of Birmingham, few women were fans of Roy Moore, but many said he had a good chance of being Alabama’s next senator.
2017-11-11.snippet: In an upper-middle-class suburb of Birmingham, few women were fans of Roy Moore, but many said he had a good chance of being Alabama’s next senator.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: VESTAVIA HILLS, Ala. — Sallie Gunter, 61, a freelance court reporter, was having breakfast with her friend Lisa Hicks, 44, a legal assistant, at Panera Bread when the subject of Roy S. Moore came up. It felt like revisiting a recurring bad dream.
2017-11-11.headline_main: For Alabama Women, Disgust, Fatigue and a Sense Moore Could Win Anyway

2017-11-11.abstract: The exhibition featuring top young players in men’s tennis is experimenting with new rules. Rarely have so many new concepts been tried all at once.
2017-11-11.snippet: The exhibition featuring top young players in men’s tennis is experimenting with new rules. Rarely have so many new concepts been tried all at once.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: The Next Gen ATP Finals tournament in Milan this week has delivered on its promise to be different from tennis as usual. Whether that is for the better or worse is still up for debate.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Oddities, Good and Bad, Abound at the Next Gen ATP Finals

2017-11-11.abstract: The suspension of parties and pledging activities at most of the school’s fraternities was the latest effort at major universities to curtail the excesses of Greek life.
2017-11-11.snippet: The suspension of parties and pledging activities at most of the school’s fraternities was the latest effort at major universities to curtail the excesses of Greek life.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Parties and pledging activities at most of University of Michigan’s fraternities have been suspended, the university said on Friday, the latest in a wave of efforts across the country to tamp down on fraternity excesses leading to sexual misconduct, alcohol and drug abuse and deaths.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Clampdown on University of Michigan Fraternities After Reports of Sexual Misconduct and Alcohol Abuse

2017-11-11.abstract: An American president champions un-American values.
2017-11-11.snippet: An American president champions un-American values.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: In recent weeks, two leaders — Xi Jinping in China and Mohammed bin Salman in Saudi Arabia — have consolidated personal power to degrees unprecedented in their countries’ recent histories. And Donald Trump, presumptive leader of the free world, has praised them both for doing it.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Trump in the Age of the Strongman

2017-11-11.abstract: What could it have been about? Oh, any number of things, a highly scientific analysis of feuding neighbors through history suggests.
2017-11-11.snippet: What could it have been about? Oh, any number of things, a highly scientific analysis of feuding neighbors through history suggests.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: When Senator Rand Paul, Republican of Kentucky, was tackled by a neighbor while riding his lawn mower this month, the initial assumption was that it was about politics. Not necessarily. It was more likely about yard waste, the developer of the gated community where the neighbors live told The Louisville Courier-Journal.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Yard Rage: The Rand Paul Assault

2017-11-11.abstract: The answer to the opioids crisis surely isn’t to pay Big Pharma to sell more pills.
2017-11-11.snippet: The answer to the opioids crisis surely isn’t to pay Big Pharma to sell more pills.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: The pharmaceutical industry was listed as one of the “Contributors to the Current Crisis” in the final report of President Trump’s Commission on Combating Drug Addiction and the Opioid Crisis. The report cites decades of aggressive marketing and industry-sponsored physician “conferences” aimed at expanding opioid use by minimizing the dangers of addiction. Lawsuits by state attorneys general, counties and local jurisdictions allege that the industry fostered the epidemic by overpromoting its products, while raking in billions as Americans became addicted and overdosed. “To this day,” the commission says, “the opioid pharmaceutical industry influences the nation’s response to the crisis.”
2017-11-11.headline_main: The Insanity of Taxpayer-Funded Addiction

2017-11-11.abstract: Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson will offer $25,000 to diplomats and staff who quit or retire early in cutbacks in diplomacy opposed by Congress.
2017-11-11.snippet: Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson will offer $25,000 to diplomats and staff who quit or retire early in cutbacks in diplomacy opposed by Congress.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The State Department will soon offer a $25,000 buyout to diplomats and staff members who quit or take early retirements by April, officials confirmed on Friday.
2017-11-11.headline_main: State Department to Offer Buyouts in Effort to Cut Staff

2017-11-11.abstract: Romney has been a veritable profile in courage by Republican standards.
2017-11-11.snippet: Romney has been a veritable profile in courage by Republican standards.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney is coming back.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Sex, Senators and — Oh Gosh, Mitt

2017-11-11.abstract: Strongly Democratic, the state would be hit hard by the loss or scaling back of widely used deductions, and the governor sees “something very odd.”
2017-11-11.snippet: Strongly Democratic, the state would be hit hard by the loss or scaling back of widely used deductions, and the governor sees “something very odd.”
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The tax plan hurtling through Congress is a fast-moving blur of cuts and increases designed to keep Republicans on track to pass a bill without Democratic votes. But here in California, where several prized deductions are at risk of being eliminated, people suspect there is a greater design at play.
2017-11-11.headline_main: California Looks at Republican Tax Measures and Sees Payback

2017-11-11.abstract: The head of Puerto Rico’s emergency management agency resigned Friday, on the same day that the Army announced that its mission on the island had ended.
2017-11-11.snippet: The head of Puerto Rico’s emergency management agency resigned Friday, on the same day that the Army announced that its mission on the island had ended.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN — The head of Puerto Rico’s emergency management agency resigned Friday, the same day that the Army general in charge of the military’s response to the hurricane announced that his mission on the island had ended.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Emergency Manager Resigns in Puerto Rico; Army Ends Its Mission

2017-11-11.abstract: The decision in favor of five immigrant workers was unusual because very few sexual harassment cases in France end up in court, let alone against such a big company.
2017-11-11.snippet: The decision in favor of five immigrant workers was unusual because very few sexual harassment cases in France end up in court, let alone against such a big company.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Five immigrant workers won a significant sexual harassment and discrimination case on Friday against one of France’s largest cleaning companies, but up to the moment they read the decision, they hardly thought they had a chance.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Employees of Big French Cleaning Company Win Sexual Harassment Case

2017-11-11.abstract: Seeking to avoid a prolonged fight with the Cowboys’ Jerry Jones, the owners negotiating the commissioner’s extension would like it done in a matter of weeks.
2017-11-11.snippet: Seeking to avoid a prolonged fight with the Cowboys’ Jerry Jones, the owners negotiating the commissioner’s extension would like it done in a matter of weeks.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. owners negotiating a contract extension for the league commissioner, Roger Goodell, are accelerating their work, according to several people familiar with the matter, to quell an insurgent, unusually public threat by Jerry Jones, the Dallas Cowboys’ owner, to scuttle the deal.
2017-11-11.headline_main: To Dodge Jerry Jones, Other Owners Speed Up Roger Goodell’s Contract

2017-11-11.abstract: Interviews and records reveal new details about contacts between George Papadopoulos and self-described Kremlin intermediaries.
2017-11-11.snippet: Interviews and records reveal new details about contacts between George Papadopoulos and self-described Kremlin intermediaries.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At midday on March 24, 2016, an improbable group gathered in a London cafe to discuss setting up a meeting between Donald J. Trump, then a candidate, and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.
2017-11-11.headline_main: A London Meeting of an Unlikely Group: How a Trump Adviser Came to Learn of Clinton ‘Dirt’

2017-11-11.abstract: One was a victim of Russian interference in the 2016 election. The other is under investigation by Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel.
2017-11-11.snippet: One was a victim of Russian interference in the 2016 election. The other is under investigation by Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — One is a rail-thin liberal idealist who spent his career in government, on campaigns and at think tanks. The other is an overweight pragmatist who made a fortune lobbying for all manner of liberal boogeymen.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Russia Scandal Befalls Two Brothers: John and Tony Podesta

2017-11-11.abstract: Around Asia, the last thing countries want is to have to choose between China and the United States.
2017-11-11.snippet: Around Asia, the last thing countries want is to have to choose between China and the United States.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: YANGON, Myanmar — President Trump is incidental to China’s ambitions, a mere blip on a 33-year plan. In a speech last month, President Xi Jinping set out the objectives with great clarity. By 2035 China will be a “global leader in innovation,” showing “solid progress” toward “prosperity for everyone.” By 2050, China will be a “global leader in terms of composite national strength” and a “great, modern socialist country.”
2017-11-11.headline_main: China Has Donald Trump Just Where It Wants Him

2017-11-11.abstract: Until I met him, I hadn’t given much thought to the many Americans who gave their lives to make mine possible.
2017-11-11.snippet: Until I met him, I hadn’t given much thought to the many Americans who gave their lives to make mine possible.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Belgrade, Me. — It was a golden day in late summer, and there in my town’s general store stood a dozen veterans missing arms and legs. Some of them wore high-tech prostheses that made them look superhuman.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Travis Mills Will Never Quit

2017-11-11.abstract: The Diocese of Brooklyn identified eight former priests who sexually abused children; four of those men committed sex crimes after they left the diocese.
2017-11-11.snippet: The Diocese of Brooklyn identified eight former priests who sexually abused children; four of those men committed sex crimes after they left the diocese.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: After leaving active ministry in 2002 as a priest in Brooklyn, Stephen Placa got his pilot’s license and founded a flight school in Ronkonkoma, Long Island, the Heritage Flight Academy. Seven years later, he was convicted in Suffolk County of the sexual abuse of two boys, ages 8 and 10.
2017-11-11.headline_main: They Quietly Left the Church, but the Sexual Abuse Continued

2017-11-11.abstract: I took my faith to war. I survived. It didn’t.
2017-11-11.snippet: I took my faith to war. I survived. It didn’t.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: I arrived in Vietnam in early February 1967 and was assigned to First Battalion, First Marines. After falling away from the church in my midteens, I’d had a religious reawakening at Parris Island, where I found myself much in need of God’s mercy because we got none from our drill instructors. I took my renewed religious fervor to Vietnam with me, and soon got to know our battalion chaplain, a Jesuit priest, pretty well.
2017-11-11.headline_main: God, Jesus and Vietnam

2017-11-11.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, November 11, 2017.
2017-11-11.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, November 11, 2017.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: “People feel they have the right to be open about Islamophobia. Or to be open about their racial views, or just to be a bit more nasty.”
2017-11-11.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: They’re Loathed as Outcasts, but This Is Home

2017-11-11.abstract: If all this was happening in Iran, it’s a fair guess that the president, Congress and a host of other voices would react with outrage.
2017-11-11.snippet: If all this was happening in Iran, it’s a fair guess that the president, Congress and a host of other voices would react with outrage.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Consider this foreign policy challenge: A Mideast leader undertakes a stunning power play to cement domestic control, carrying out mass arrests without due process and installing loyalists in key ministries. He ratchets up criticism of a regional rival and accuses it of effectively declaring war. And another Mideast leader, while on a visit to the first one’s country, abruptly resigns and doesn’t return home.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Saudi Arabia’s Special Power Over Donald Trump

2017-11-11.abstract: In its war with Iran, Riyadh has its sights set on Lebanon’s most powerful political force.
2017-11-11.snippet: In its war with Iran, Riyadh has its sights set on Lebanon’s most powerful political force.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Lebanon was stunned on Nov. 4 when its prime minister, Saad Hariri, speaking from Saudi Arabia, delivered a halting resignation speech. Mr. Hariri said he left Beirut because he feared assassination. He placed the blame for his long-distance resignation on Iran and its main ally in Lebanon, Hezbollah.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Saudi Arabia Comes for Hezbollah

2017-11-11.abstract: George Barany and Michael Shteyman offer us a complex Saturday puzzle.
2017-11-11.snippet: George Barany and Michael Shteyman offer us a complex Saturday puzzle.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — Last Saturday we had a puzzle from Michael Shteyman that was a surprise in the sense that 1) we don’t hear from Mr. Shteyman all that often, and 2) it turned out to be a Saturday puzzle with a theme. We don’t see many of those either.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Members of the ‘Hive’

2017-11-11.abstract: The offer, which would unite the country’s two largest toy companies, comes as toymakers try to compete with electronic devices and video entertainment.
2017-11-11.snippet: The offer, which would unite the country’s two largest toy companies, comes as toymakers try to compete with electronic devices and video entertainment.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Hasbro has made a bid to acquire its chief rival Mattel, according to people briefed on the discussions, a move that would further consolidate the world’s toy industry.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Hasbro Said to Make Bid for Toy Rival Mattel

2017-11-11.abstract: Corrections appearing in print on Saturday, November 11, 2017.
2017-11-11.snippet: Corrections appearing in print on Saturday, November 11, 2017.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL
2017-11-11.headline_main: Corrections: November 11, 2017

2017-11-11.abstract: It is hard to overstate the long history of Vietnamese antipathy toward the Chinese. But with the U.S. apparently withdrawing from the region, Hanoi can’t ignore Beijing.
2017-11-11.snippet: It is hard to overstate the long history of Vietnamese antipathy toward the Chinese. But with the U.S. apparently withdrawing from the region, Hanoi can’t ignore Beijing.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: HANOI, Vietnam — Vietnam’s full-on war with the United States lasted a decade. Its tensions with its northern neighbor, China, have persisted for thousands of years — from a millennium of direct Chinese rule and a bloody border war in 1979 to more recent confrontations in the South China Sea.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Vietnam, in a Bind, Tries to Chart a Path Between U.S. and China

2017-11-11.abstract: The Texas city’s response to a powerful storm says much about polarized visions of the country and diverging attitudes toward cities, race, liberty and science.
2017-11-11.snippet: The Texas city’s response to a powerful storm says much about polarized visions of the country and diverging attitudes toward cities, race, liberty and science.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: The Texas city’s response to a powerful storm says much about polarized visions of the country and diverging attitudes toward cities, race, liberty and science.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Lessons From Hurricane Harvey: Houston’s Struggle Is America’s Tale

2017-11-11.snippet: The Olympian Hong Kong offers massive rooms, complimentary smartphones and a location with some of the best dining districts in the city.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: From about 1,755 Hong Kong dollars (or about $225, at 7.8 Hong Kong dollars to the dollar)
2017-11-11.headline_main: At an Opulent Hong Kong Hotel, Room to Roam

2017-11-11.abstract: Dubai says it welcomes foreigners, but some end up in prison for offenses that few Westerners would dream were even crimes.
2017-11-11.snippet: Dubai says it welcomes foreigners, but some end up in prison for offenses that few Westerners would dream were even crimes.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates — A Scottish electrician named Jamie Harron, visiting Dubai as a tourist, was sentenced to three months in jail for touching a man in a bar.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Holding Hands, Drinking Wine and Other Ways to Go to Jail in Dubai

2017-11-11.abstract: Extravagant spending, bad investments and other perils face those who suddenly come into a large sum of money.
2017-11-11.snippet: Extravagant spending, bad investments and other perils face those who suddenly come into a large sum of money.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Winning the lottery can be a bolt of amazing luck. But whether the luck lasts depends on whether lottery winners fritter away their unexpected largess or manage to achieve financial security.
2017-11-11.headline_main: I Won the Lottery and I Need Help. No, Really!

2017-11-11.abstract: In the world of travel, Cyber Monday — on Nov. 27 this year — means attractive deals on hotel stays, safaris, group tours and more.
2017-11-11.snippet: In the world of travel, Cyber Monday — on Nov. 27 this year — means attractive deals on hotel stays, safaris, group tours and more.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Cyber Monday, on Nov. 27 this year, isn’t just a day to score discounts on retail goods — in the world of travel, it means attractive deals on hotel stays, safaris, group tours and more.
2017-11-11.headline_main: 7 Cyber Monday Travel Deals

2017-11-11.abstract: A company called Liveops has become the Uber of call centers by doting on its agents. But is the work liberating, or dehumanizing?
2017-11-11.snippet: A company called Liveops has become the Uber of call centers by doting on its agents. But is the work liberating, or dehumanizing?
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: DURHAM, N.C. — The gathering in a private dining room at a Mexican restaurant had the fervent energy of a megachurch service, or maybe an above-average “Oprah” episode — a mix of revival-style confession and extravagant empathy. There were souls to be won.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Plugging Into the Gig Economy, From Home With a Headset

2017-11-11.abstract: Our top 10 comments of the week: Readers discussed Democratic election gains, more sexual assault revelations and a screaming toddler.
2017-11-11.snippet: Our top 10 comments of the week: Readers discussed Democratic election gains, more sexual assault revelations and a screaming toddler.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.
2017-11-11.headline_main: ‘“We the People” Are Out of Hibernation’

2017-11-11.abstract: The Whitney Plantation became the only plantation museum in Louisiana with a focus on slavery when it opened to the public in 2014.
2017-11-11.snippet: The Whitney Plantation became the only plantation museum in Louisiana with a focus on slavery when it opened to the public in 2014.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: The Whitney Plantation became the only plantation museum in Louisiana with a focus on slavery when it opened to the public in 2014.

2017-11-11.abstract: The Texas city’s response to a powerful storm says much about polarized visions of the country and diverging attitudes toward cities, race, liberty and science.
2017-11-11.snippet: The Texas city’s response to a powerful storm says much about polarized visions of the country and diverging attitudes toward cities, race, liberty and science.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — The mayhem that Hurricane Harvey unleashed on Houston didn’t only come from the sky. On the ground, it came sweeping in from the Katy Prairie some 30 miles west of downtown.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Lessons From Hurricane Harvey: Houston’s Struggle Is America’s Tale

2017-11-11.abstract: For a number of reasons, many parents on social media seem uncomfortable displaying the help they get for their children from paid caretakers.
2017-11-11.snippet: For a number of reasons, many parents on social media seem uncomfortable displaying the help they get for their children from paid caretakers.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Dikla Goren Dekel, a Brooklyn-based mother of three who writes the lifestyle blog Girl Plus Two, shares a lot of her life on Instagram. A photo from last month shows her and her children eating sandwiches in their underwear. In a rare child-free shot from Burning Man, Ms. Dekel gazes at her husband, Noam, and muses that the desert bacchanal could “get me pregnant again.”
2017-11-11.headline_main: Where Are All the Nannies on Instagram?

2017-11-11.abstract: The Sugars answer letters from bereaved parents who worry that their grief may overshadow their surviving children.
2017-11-11.snippet: The Sugars answer letters from bereaved parents who worry that their grief may overshadow their surviving children.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: When a parent loses a child, the decision to have another can be fraught with mixed emotions. One letter writer, who calls herself “Mama with Complicated Joy,” had a baby following the death of her older son. “I feel like I’m nursing twins,” she writes, “grief on the left side, joy on the right.”
2017-11-11.headline_main: Listen to ‘Dear Sugars’: The Empty Chair Part 2

2017-11-11.abstract: As accusations against powerful men mount, a safe space to work, primp, pump and rage against the patriarchy is getting new locations and a magazine.
2017-11-11.snippet: As accusations against powerful men mount, a safe space to work, primp, pump and rage against the patriarchy is getting new locations and a magazine.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: From the doorstep of 52 Mercer Street in SoHo on a recent Thursday night, a line of women mostly in their 20s and 30s, exuding anticipation, snaked halfway around the next block. A man asked what they were waiting for as he walked by. No one seemed to notice him and no one answered. What business was it of his anyway?
2017-11-11.headline_main: The Wing, a Chic Women’s Club, Is Going Wide

2017-11-11.abstract: The goal of Reem’s is to show its customers the complex world of Middle Eastern food that lies beyond hummus and falafel. And it succeeds.
2017-11-11.snippet: The goal of Reem’s is to show its customers the complex world of Middle Eastern food that lies beyond hummus and falafel. And it succeeds.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Before she embarked on a baking career, Reem Assil grew up in a Palestinian-Syrian household and spent a decade as a community organizer. Both of these things are evident at Reem’s California, the bright, bustling Arab bakery Ms. Assil opened in Oakland’s Fruitvale neighborhood in May.
2017-11-11.headline_main: An Arab Bakery in Oakland Full of California Love

2017-11-11.abstract: A Norwegian explorer seeks one of New York's most elusive commodities.
2017-11-11.snippet: A Norwegian explorer seeks one of New York's most elusive commodities.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Erling Kagge, a 54-year-old Norwegian explorer, author and publisher, was sitting one morning last month in the private gardens at the Church of St. Luke in the Fields, a green oasis of relative quiet in the West Village of Manhattan.
2017-11-11.headline_main: In Search of Silence

2017-11-11.abstract: The photographer Daniel Weiss found versions of his teenage self in the East Village of Manhattan.
2017-11-11.snippet: The photographer Daniel Weiss found versions of his teenage self in the East Village of Manhattan.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: Anyone who has used Ninth Street to cross Tompkins Square Park has seen the skateboarders who occupy its northeast corner. Many of them call it the T.F. Others call it Thompson’s. T.F. stands for “training facility” (though very little official training takes place here), and Thompson’s comes out of a phonetic misunderstanding that comes from knowing a place verbally, rather than on a map.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Eternal Youth in Tompkins Square Park

2017-11-11.abstract: Reconciling the contradictory messages to the region may determine the near-term fate of the United States as a Pacific power.
2017-11-11.snippet: Reconciling the contradictory messages to the region may determine the near-term fate of the United States as a Pacific power.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: DANANG, Vietnam — President Trump has issued two starkly contradictory calls on his trip to Asia this past week: The nations of the world must rally behind the United States to confront the nuclear threat from North Korea, but they should expect America to go its own way on trade.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Trump to Asia: Unite on North Korea, but Go It Alone on Trade

2017-11-11.abstract: As President Trump dismissed global trade talks, the other members of the Trans-Pacific Partnership revived a major multinational agreement that would include American allies.
2017-11-11.snippet: As President Trump dismissed global trade talks, the other members of the Trans-Pacific Partnership revived a major multinational agreement that would include American allies.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — President Trump shook up the world economic order this year by pulling the United States out of a major international trade pact and raising fundamental questions about its global role.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Trans-Pacific Trade Partners Are Moving On, Without the U.S.

2017-11-11.abstract: One Air Force colleague recalled how Devin P. Kelley, when punished for poor performance, would cry, scream and shake with rage, vowing to kill his superiors.
2017-11-11.snippet: One Air Force colleague recalled how Devin P. Kelley, when punished for poor performance, would cry, scream and shake with rage, vowing to kill his superiors.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: At the start of his Air Force career, Devin P. Kelley was picked for a demanding and selective intelligence analyst school. He walked into his first Monday of class with a crisp blue uniform, shined shoes, and for perhaps the first time in years, with hope. It didn’t last.

2017-11-11.snippet: Machines regularly used to kill innocent people violate the core of our faith.
2017-11-11.lead_paragraph: SUTHERLAND SPRINGS, Tex. — Here in rural Texas, the hay, baled and rolled, waits for winter. The corn is shorn and the stiff yucca stands guard in the dusk. I know this country; it is a short drive from my home, past places like the Devil’s Backbone and Purgatory to skinny Cibolo Creek, choked by mesquite and live oak. In Sutherland Springs, a family of five trudges in front of me in the headlights, past the police cordon, shuffling, heads down, apparently headed home. They call it God’s country, partly for its beauty, partly because it sometimes feels like God is the only thing out here.
2017-11-11.headline_main: Why Christians Must Support Gun Control

This summer’s images of violence in Charlottesville, Va., prompted an array of questions. “Some people hate others because they are different,” I offer, lamely. 2017-11-12.abstract: As technology has made extraordinary leaps, autonomous vehicles may cease to be science fiction. The Times Magazine’s Tech & Design issue ponders: What happens then?
2017-11-12.snippet: As technology has made extraordinary leaps, autonomous vehicles may cease to be science fiction. The Times Magazine’s Tech & Design issue ponders: What happens then?
2017-11-12.lead_paragraph: Ever since I started as an editor at The New York Times Magazine a little more than three years ago, one of my main guiding principles has been: Don’t go too far out on a limb. That precept feels particularly important to me because many of the stories I oversee are about science and technology, two subjects where it can be easy for journalists to get too far ahead of the facts. A new study might suggest some scientific breakthrough is on the horizon, but The Times should never cover it in a way that seems to imply it’s already here. In my previous job, at Wired magazine, my colleagues and I had one example of hyperactive prognostication that we used as a running joke: “commuting in dirigibles.” That absurd mental image was a stand-in for all the other ridiculous sci-fi fantasies that, cool as they may look on a magazine cover, have basically no chance of arriving.
2017-11-12.headline_main: The New York Times Takes a Trip to a Driverless Future

2017-11-12.abstract: A mural in a Bronx body shop portrays the island’s recovery efforts in a heroic light, likening its people’s resolve to the flag-raising at Iwo Jima.
2017-11-12.snippet: A mural in a Bronx body shop portrays the island’s recovery efforts in a heroic light, likening its people’s resolve to the flag-raising at Iwo Jima.
2017-11-12.lead_paragraph: Mike Vargas knows how to deal with wrecks, even ones that could take years. The cars he repairs or soups up inside his northeast Bronx auto body shop, East Coast Customs Automotive Playground, seem like easy fixes compared with the devastation in Puerto Rico, where he has family and property. Now, while he works on his cars, a vibrant mural looms over him, constantly reminding him of more dire human challenges. Suggesting the famous photograph, “Raising the Flag on Iwo Jima,” the mural depicts hard-hatted workers lifting a flag-topped utility pole over a devastated landscape.
2017-11-12.headline_main: Battered and Tattered, Puerto Rico’s Flag Still Waves

2017-11-12.abstract: R J Smith’s “American Witness” is a biography of the pioneering photographer and filmmaker.
2017-11-12.snippet: R J Smith’s “American Witness” is a biography of the pioneering photographer and filmmaker.
2017-11-12.lead_paragraph: The subject of R J Smith’s 2012 biography “The One: The Life and Music of James Brown” lived a life that was, to say the least, highly visible. For his new book, “American Witness,” Mr. Smith chose a far more reclusive subject — the Swiss-born photographer and filmmaker Robert Frank, best known for “The Americans,” a groundbreaking 1959 book of black-and-white photos that offered an unvarnished look at the country at midcentury. (“I’ve always wished I could write songs the way he takes pictures,” Bruce Springsteen once said.) Mr. Frank, now in his 90s, was an integral part of the cultural churn of New York City in the 1950s and ’60s. Mr. Smith writes of “The Americans” in his biography: “Robert Frank wants to connect with his country,” and “he hunts for a shared identity. But he also wants to be profoundly lost and unknown. He lives in the street and yearns to move silently among people who don’t recognize him.” Below, Mr. Smith talks about first learning of Mr. Frank in a rock magazine in the 1970s, how “American Witness” became darker and more ambiguous as he wrote it, his fascination with one of the Three Stooges, and more.
2017-11-12.headline_main: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: Capturing the Elusive Robert Frank

2017-11-12.abstract: In his new film “I Love You, Daddy,” the comic surveys male pathologies, nods at Woody Allen and reaffirms cinema’s long history of exploiting women.
2017-11-12.snippet: In his new film “I Love You, Daddy,” the comic surveys male pathologies, nods at Woody Allen and reaffirms cinema’s long history of exploiting women.
2017-11-12.lead_paragraph: Soon after Harvey Weinstein was first outed as a sexual predator, I created a document titled “Creeps” in which I tried to list every man who had sexually harassed or assaulted me. It’s a companion to the running inventory that I keep in my head of the male filmmakers, in Hollywood and out, whose work degrades or disdains women. This is another kind of cinematic canon, one that includes directors I loathe and those I otherwise sometimes admire, however reluctantly. I imagine that a lot of women who love movies even when the movies don’t love us back have their own such lists.
2017-11-12.headline_main: Louis C.K. and Hollywood’s Canon of Creeps

2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: After racing through 20 years of separation, “Outlander” spent three episodes setting up all of the issues underlying Jamie and Claire’s reunion. With this week’s episode, the season undergoes a literal sea change by lifting them out of any familiar ground and stranding them on a boat to the West Indies — a bottle episode on open waters. And as with many bottle episodes, it’s a chance to take stock of what’s working this season and what isn’t.

2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: The ambiguous conclusion of last week’s episode left the fan favorite Ezekiel in dire straits, as his loyal subjects dove to protect him from a hail of gunfire. I wrote, in my recap, of my concerns about the show’s habit of playing it fast and loose with “gotcha” non-deaths, as well as about the hazards of eliminating a valuable force for positivity on such a bleak program. From this sticky narrative wicket, this week’s episode nimbly spins a cohesive and affecting story that places a standout supporting player in a well-earned spotlight. Ezekiel’s flame of hope does, indeed, get extinguished. But first, the episode earns that withering defeat.

2017-11-13.abstract: For campaign managers like Kathryn Sorenson, much of their job was simply channeling the enormous wave of energy that came their way.
2017-11-13.snippet: For campaign managers like Kathryn Sorenson, much of their job was simply channeling the enormous wave of energy that came their way.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: on the morning of the Women’s March on Washington in January, Kathryn Sorenson was an hour west of D.C., en route to her new apartment, when a car broadsided her and broke her neck. She had been passing through a dangerous intersection — busy roads, no stoplights — and her first thought, as she waited for the ambulance to arrive, was about the inadequacy of local governance: In the Northern Virginia exurbs, rapid growth has long outstripped traffic oversight. Still, as a young Democratic campaign manager, it seemed to her vaguely unprofessional to have broken her neck on such a politically momentous day. “I wasn’t even out fighting the machine,” she said, “just coming back from the dry cleaners.” The first to arrive at her hospital bed — before her mother — were David Reid, a local businessman, and his wife, who had called around to every regional emergency room until they found her.
2017-11-13.headline_main: How the ‘Resistance’ Helped Democrats Dominate Virginia

Mr. Stewart, as the host of “The Daily Show,” honed a pointed, partisan perspective that rooted out hypocrisy in current events. 2017-11-13.abstract: With old maps in one hand and Google Maps in the other, the author Russell Shorto roams across the city’s five boroughs, searching for remnants of the American Revolution.
2017-11-13.snippet: With old maps in one hand and Google Maps in the other, the author Russell Shorto roams across the city’s five boroughs, searching for remnants of the American Revolution.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: New York City is a battlefield. I know what you’re thinking — psychological warfare, the endless grim clashing of economic forces — but I am being literal. When we ponder America’s defining war, the Revolution, we think of Bunker Hill, or Saratoga, or Lexington and Concord, yet its largest battle, a vast and ferociously fought chess match in August and September of 1776, right after the formal declaration of the colonies’ independence, ranged over what are now the five boroughs. As to why the place was so hotly contested, you already know the answer. Then, as now, as ever, New York City was the center of it all. Both sides believed that if the British took control of New York and the Hudson River, the American resistance would likely collapse.
2017-11-13.headline_main: When New York City Was a (Literal) Battlefield

2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: THE MORNING SCHOOL run proceeds, at first glance, like any number of demographically adjacent — affluent, socially progressive, private — school runs the world over: There are lithe yoga moms, dads with beards and the occasional man bun, kids with Messi jerseys and top-heavy backpacks. There are hurried embraces and pods of parents, to-go lattes in hand, swapping information and gossip. This boisterous procession — from filing past the security guard to the mass exodus when the first-period bell sounds — takes 10 minutes before calm descends.

2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: Q. I recently discovered the keyboard shortcut in Windows 10 that automatically zooms in the whole screen, but it’s often a little too close-up. Is there a way to adjust this zooming?

2017-11-13.snippet: Alex M. Azar II, a lawyer, was also a health official in the George W. Bush administration
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump, who has repeatedly assailed pharmaceutical companies for the high cost of prescription medications in the United States, nominated on Monday a former executive of one of the nation’s largest drug companies to be secretary of health and human services, which has responsibility for regulating the pharmaceutical industry.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Former Eli Lilly Executive Is Trump’s Choice for Health Secretary

2017-11-13.abstract: Wang Huning, a close adviser to the Chinese leader, Xi Jinping, has brought a steadiness of vision and purpose to China’s rivalry with the United States.
2017-11-13.snippet: Wang Huning, a close adviser to the Chinese leader, Xi Jinping, has brought a steadiness of vision and purpose to China’s rivalry with the United States.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — He was a brilliant student during the dark days of China’s Cultural Revolution. He visited America, and left unimpressed with democracy. Plucked from academia, he climbed the ladder of Beijing’s brutal politics.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Behind the Scenes, Communist Strategist Presses China’s Rise

2017-11-13.abstract: An area in Yorkshire topped a national survey, upsetting stereotypes that northern England is colder, poorer and less sophisticated than the south.
2017-11-13.snippet: An area in Yorkshire topped a national survey, upsetting stereotypes that northern England is colder, poorer and less sophisticated than the south.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: SKIPTON, England — Britain’s economy is slowing. Talks on quitting the European Union have stalled. And the government is in disarray, troubled by cabinet resignations and embroiled in a series of sex and sleaze accusations.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Yes, This Is Britain’s Happiest Place. (It Looks Beautiful in the Rain.)

2017-11-13.abstract: The world’s flies do much more than annoy us. Pollinating plants, cleaning up carcasses, swabbing drains — flies are part of every strand of the web of life.
2017-11-13.snippet: The world’s flies do much more than annoy us. Pollinating plants, cleaning up carcasses, swabbing drains — flies are part of every strand of the web of life.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: For each person on earth, there are 17 million flies. They pollinate plants, consume decomposing bodies, eat the sludge in your drainpipes, damage crops, spread disease, kill spiders, hunt dragonflies.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Trillions of Flies Can’t All Be Bad

2017-11-13.abstract: James Clement has scoured the globe for supercentenarians, aged 110 and older, willing to contribute their genomes to a rare scientific cache.
2017-11-13.snippet: James Clement has scoured the globe for supercentenarians, aged 110 and older, willing to contribute their genomes to a rare scientific cache.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: As one of the exceedingly rare members of her species to live beyond age 110, Goldie Michelson had divulged her secrets to longevity countless times before dying last year at 113.
2017-11-13.headline_main: The Secret to Long Life? It May Lurk in the DNA of the Oldest Among Us

2017-11-13.abstract: A mother, father and their two children reunited in New York after emigrating separately from the Dominican Republic. But it has sometimes been a struggle to reconnect.
2017-11-13.snippet: A mother, father and their two children reunited in New York after emigrating separately from the Dominican Republic. But it has sometimes been a struggle to reconnect.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: They counted down the hours until the plane’s 6 p.m. arrival. As they waited to be permanently reunited with family, Francisco Castro and his daughter Ashanty spent the day cooking stewed chicken with beans and rice, a taste of home.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Learning How to Be a Family Again After Years Apart

2017-11-13.abstract: Fall temperatures are dropping: Make up a warming bowl of something, like a firehouse chili gumbo or an herbed white bean stew.
2017-11-13.snippet: Fall temperatures are dropping: Make up a warming bowl of something, like a firehouse chili gumbo or an herbed white bean stew.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here. Download the NYT Cooking app here.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Cold Weather Recipes, Feat. Taylor Swift

2017-11-13.abstract: The new movie about P.T. Barnum is a risky proposition: an original musical period piece. But it does have the team from “La La Land” on board.
2017-11-13.snippet: The new movie about P.T. Barnum is a risky proposition: an original musical period piece. But it does have the team from “La La Land” on board.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: “Ladies and gents, this is the moment you’ve waited for,” Hugh Jackman sings in the trailer for the P.T. Barnum biopic “The Greatest Showman.” Whether that’s true will be determined when this cinematic circus comes to town on Dec. 20, but 20th Century Fox has put together a number of winning elements to hedge its bet on a risky proposition: an original musical period piece.

2017-11-13.abstract: One case asks whether centers operated by abortion opponents must provide information on the procedure. The other is on political apparel at polling places.
2017-11-13.snippet: One case asks whether centers operated by abortion opponents must provide information on the procedure. The other is on political apparel at polling places.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear two cases on the limits of the First Amendment’s protection of free speech. One asks whether California may require “crisis pregnancy centers” to provide information about abortion. The other is a challenge to a Minnesota law that forbids wearing political buttons, badges and other insignia at polling places.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Justices Take Cases on Free Speech at Pregnancy Centers and Polling Places

2017-11-13.abstract: There are ways to deviate from normalized stupidity, although doing so isn’t always easy. Start by calling out the crazy, from gun violence to environmental sins.
2017-11-13.snippet: There are ways to deviate from normalized stupidity, although doing so isn’t always easy. Start by calling out the crazy, from gun violence to environmental sins.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: Just because something is normal doesn’t mean that it isn’t stupid.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Healthy Deviants Know the Difference Between Normal and Stupid

2017-11-13.abstract: Brett J. Talley was asked to name family members who might be a conflict of interest. He did not mention that his wife is the White House counsel’s chief of staff.

2017-11-13.abstract: As Republicans began debating a $1.5 trillion tax cut, President Trump suggested lawmakers cut rates further and repeal the Affordable Care Act mandate.
2017-11-13.snippet: As Republicans began debating a $1.5 trillion tax cut, President Trump suggested lawmakers cut rates further and repeal the Affordable Care Act mandate.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As Republican lawmakers worked on Monday toward a delicate compromise on a $1.5 trillion tax cut, President Trump threw himself back into the discussion, suggesting that Republicans could reduce taxes even further by repealing the Affordable Care Act’s mandate that most people have health insurance.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Trump Again Wades Into Tax Debate, Suggesting Repeal of Obamacare Mandate

2017-11-13.abstract: A relative unknown prepares to follow Graydon Carter, who embraced the role of celebrity editor during his 25 years at the helm.
2017-11-13.snippet: A relative unknown prepares to follow Graydon Carter, who embraced the role of celebrity editor during his 25 years at the helm.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: Radhika Jones grew up around music. Her father, Robert L. Jones, a singer and guitarist, was a prominent figure on the Cambridge, Mass., folk scene of the late 1950s and early 1960s. When he decided he wanted to travel less, she sold T-shirts and worked the box office at the many events, including the Newport Jazz and Folk Festivals, he helped produce.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Radhika Jones, Vanity Fair’s Surprise Choice, Is Ready to Go

2017-11-13.abstract: Brown’s new book is an edited version of the diaries she kept while presiding over the high-powered magazine at a time when editors still had time and money to burn.
2017-11-13.snippet: Brown’s new book is an edited version of the diaries she kept while presiding over the high-powered magazine at a time when editors still had time and money to burn.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: In the introductory chapter of “The Vanity Fair Diaries: 1983-1992,” today’s Tina Brown weighs in on young Tina Brown, and her verdict is clear: From day one, she was hot, hot, hot. Her work for The New Statesman right after university? “Frisky.” Her 1977 affair with the “fearless, crusading” Harold Evans, whom she’d one day marry? “A scandale.” Her old college flame Martin Amis? A “literary lothario” who was “small and Jaggeresque.”
2017-11-13.headline_main: Tina Brown’s ‘Vanity Fair Diaries’ Recall a Glossier Time

2017-11-13.abstract: The new accusations came hours after Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, declared that he believes the accusers and urged Mr. Moore, a Senate candidate, to step aside.

Moore on Monday of sexually assaulting her when she was 16, the fifth and most brutal charge leveled against the Republican Senate candidate. Senate Republicans are now openly discussing not seating him or expelling him if he wins the Dec. 12 special election.

2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: When Elle Fraser, a business operations assistant for the New Jersey Devils, came down with the flu just before Thanksgiving last year, she didn’t think about staying home from work.
2017-11-13.headline_main: If You’re Sick, Stay Away From Work. If You Can’t, Here Is What Doctors Advise.

2017-11-13.abstract: The photographer’s social conscience, revealed in a show at Pace/MacGill and a new edition of “Nothing Personal,” deepens his enduring legacy.
2017-11-13.snippet: The photographer’s social conscience, revealed in a show at Pace/MacGill and a new edition of “Nothing Personal,” deepens his enduring legacy.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: In 1964, Richard Avedon published “Nothing Personal,” a lavish coffee table book with gravure-printed portraits of individuals who do not fit into any single classification: Allen Ginsberg standing naked in a Buddhist pose opposite George Lincoln Rockwell, the founder of the American Nazi Party; the puffy-eyed Dorothy Parker, her bags containing a lifetime of tears, side by side with a sullen and deflated, if still-shimmering, Marilyn Monroe; a young and earnest Julian Bond among members of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee; and the grizzled William Casby, who had been born into slavery about 100 years earlier.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Why Richard Avedon’s Work Has Never Been More Relevant

2017-11-13.abstract: The terrorist spree took 130 lives in a trauma that reshaped the balance between security and civil liberties in France.
2017-11-13.snippet: The terrorist spree took 130 lives in a trauma that reshaped the balance between security and civil liberties in France.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: PARIS — France paid homage on Monday to the victims of the coordinated terrorist attacks in and around Paris two years ago that left 130 dead and more than 600 wounded, a national trauma that reshaped the country’s balance between security and civil liberties.
2017-11-13.headline_main: The Paris Attacks, 2 Years Later: Quiet Remembrance and Lasting Impact

2017-11-13.abstract: A media frenzy after the mass shooting in Sutherland Springs makes a correspondent wonder if it’s time to discuss how such events are covered.
2017-11-13.snippet: A media frenzy after the mass shooting in Sutherland Springs makes a correspondent wonder if it’s time to discuss how such events are covered.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: SUTHERLAND SPRINGS, Tex. — It wasn’t the television presenters elbowing their way to the front of the scrum near the massacre scene that finally drove home how the news media was aggravating the tragedy here. It wasn’t the run on food at Theresa’s Kitchen or the point at which the number of journalists seemed to rival the few hundred souls of the town’s population.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Covering a Mass Shooting, and Adding to a Town’s Pain

2017-11-13.abstract: The revelations that the SEAL commandos have been under suspicion of stealing money from a fund used to pay informants shed light on a potential motive in the mysterious Mali death.

2017-11-13.abstract: People who have lost someone will take comfort from what Biden has to say about losing his son Beau to brain cancer in “Promise Me, Dad.”
2017-11-13.snippet: People who have lost someone will take comfort from what Biden has to say about losing his son Beau to brain cancer in “Promise Me, Dad.”
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: During the summer of 2013, Joe Biden’s oldest son, Beau, learned he had a glioblastoma, an especially ferocious and pitiless type of brain tumor. Biden told almost no one. His grief did not spill into open view. But eventually, the world came to know. Beau Biden — Iraq War veteran, former attorney general of the state of Delaware — died on May 30, 2015. He was 46.
2017-11-13.headline_main: In Joe Biden’s Memoir, Private Grief and Its Effect on a Public Life

2017-11-13.abstract: A German-Syrian artist has recreated a famous photograph of a barricade made of buses during the Syrian civil war.
2017-11-13.snippet: A German-Syrian artist has recreated a famous photograph of a barricade made of buses during the Syrian civil war.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: Three buses stand on their heads in front of the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin in an installation that recreates a makeshift barricade erected in Aleppo, Syria, in 2015 to protect civilians against snipers during the height of the country’s civil war. The installation, “Monument,” by the Syrian-German artist Manaf Halbouni, is based on a picture of the barrier taken by the photographer Karam Al-Masri that was widely shared on the internet at the time.
2017-11-13.headline_main: A Monument to Syria’s Civil War Is Erected in Berlin

2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: Jacob Lawrence’s parents were two of the millions who took part in the Great Migration, the 20th-century flow of black Americans from the South to the North. Lawrence was just 23 when he produced his sweeping masterwork, “The Migration Series” (1941), 60 modernist tableaus depicting the journey and what drove it.

Bits of shell stay in the heavy container. Made of zinc and brass, it’s definitely gift-worthy: Drosselmeyer Gold Nutcracker, $49.99, primarygroup.net.

Wells’s “The War of the Worlds,” Orson Welles and his Mercury Theater troupe proved that simulated news — in that case, an uncannily realistic account of an alien invasion — could make for pulse-quickening, even panic-inducing entertainment.

2017-11-13.abstract: Criticizing wrongheaded or shortsighted decisions by senior officials is very different from divulging classified information.

2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: President Trump reignited controversy about Russia recently by declaring he believes that its president, Vladimir Putin, is sincere when he asserts that Moscow did not interfere in last year’s presidential election. The director of the C.I.A., Mike Pompeo, made similarly confounding remarks last month when he said that Russia’s campaign had failed to affect the outcome of the election, misrepresenting the formal judgment of the intelligence community. A C.I.A. spokesman later said that Mr. Pompeo had misspoken.

2017-11-13.abstract: Trump’s initial figure turns out to be woefully low.
2017-11-13.snippet: Trump’s initial figure turns out to be woefully low.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: Early last month, President Trump visited Puerto Rico on a trip designed to signal the federal government’s recognition of the unfolding catastrophe from Hurricane Maria. When the hurricane crashed into Puerto Rico on Sept. 20, it cut off electricity to nearly all of the island’s 3.4 million residents, destroyed 80 percent of the agricultural supply, knocked out cellular phone service, blocked roads, decimated homes and left at least 1.7 million people without potable water.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Puerto Rico’s Actual Death Toll

2017-11-13.snippet: This flourless chocolate tart from Runner & Stone carries the flavors of autumn, and the chew of a brownie.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: “Imagine me baking something flourless!” said Peter Endriss, a partner in the Brooklyn bakery and restaurant Runner & Stone, who isn’t in the gluten-free camp. He calls his intense new flourless chocolate creation a tart, though it’s more like a big brownie showered with cinnamon, nutmeg and clove-spiced pecans. It’s baked in a fluted form, like a giant cupcake liner, giving it the look of a tart even though it has no pastry crust. Bless it with some clouds of whipped cream or crème fraîche: Spiced Pecan Flourless Chocolate Tart, $33, to order 48 hours in advance, Runner & Stone, 285 Third Avenue (Carroll Street), Gowanus, Brooklyn, 718-576-3360,  runnerandstone.com.
2017-11-13.headline_main: They Call It a Tart, but It’s All Brownie

2017-11-13.abstract: The chief executive, John Flannery, said he was looking for G.E.’s “soul,” a noble goal, but shareholders must wonder why it took its 18 directors so long to fix its problems.
2017-11-13.snippet: The chief executive, John Flannery, said he was looking for G.E.’s “soul,” a noble goal, but shareholders must wonder why it took its 18 directors so long to fix its problems.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: It doesn’t take much imagination to grasp the religious undertones in General Electric boss John Flannery’s plan for the $178 billion conglomerate. He says he is “looking for the soul of the company again.” Now, some 100 days into the job, Mr. Flannery has categorically exorcised the ghosts of false expectations past by halving its dividend, reducing earnings guidance and questioning entire swaths of the company’s portfolio of industrial assets. Next up is G.E.’s board of directors.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Asking the Big Questions of General Electric

He was 72.

2017-11-13.abstract: The horrors of a refugee crisis that the world feels free to ignore.
2017-11-13.snippet: The horrors of a refugee crisis that the world feels free to ignore.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: Earlier this month, the bodies of 26 teenagers were found floating in the Mediterranean Sea. The corpses were sent to Salerno, Italy, where autopsies are being conducted to determine the details of their deaths. The girls were probably victims of sex trafficking, originally picked up in southern Nigeria, held in Libya and then sent to Italian shores in dinghies. Aid workers suspect that, like many African girls trafficked before them, they were tortured and raped.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Two Dozen African Girls Dead at Sea

2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: In a year of unprecedented power for Major League Baseball, it was only fitting that the rookies of the year would be record-setting sluggers. The Yankees’ Aaron Judge, who bashed 52 homers, and the Los Angeles Dodgers’ Cody Bellinger, who hit 39, were named unanimous winners of their leagues’ awards on Monday.

2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: The other day, Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader, admitted to The New York Times that he “misspoke” when he declared that his party’s tax plan wouldn’t raise taxes on any middle-class families. But he misspoke when he said “misspoke”: The proper term is “lied.”

2017-11-13.abstract: The president’s grand trip failed to produce meaningful concessions from China on trade and if anything strengthened Beijing’s hand in Asia.
2017-11-13.snippet: The president’s grand trip failed to produce meaningful concessions from China on trade and if anything strengthened Beijing’s hand in Asia.
2017-11-13.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s recently concluded trip to Asia had the potential to advance important American security and economic interests. Played correctly, his ambitious five-country, 12-day trip could have steadied his administration’s rocky start in this vital region. Instead, it left the United States more isolated and in retreat, handing leadership of the newly christened “Indo-Pacific” to China on a silver platter.
2017-11-13.headline_main: Susan Rice: Trump Is Making China Great Again

2017-11-14.abstract: The insurgent media company has built a devoted following of what it sees as “average” sports fans: unruly, occasionally toxic and aggressively male.
2017-11-14.snippet: The insurgent media company has built a devoted following of what it sees as “average” sports fans: unruly, occasionally toxic and aggressively male.
2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: In the offices of Barstool Sports, on two floors of a narrow building in the Flatiron district of Manhattan, there’s a full bar, a semicircle of sticky leather recliners and a wall of flat-screen televisions. Almost every other bit of square footage on the editorial floor is occupied by a dude at work — dudes carrying props, dudes spitting tobacco juice into plastic bottles, dudes typing up blog posts and tracking page views. The center of the space, marked by a giant menorah, operates as a full-time modular studio, pumping out all sorts of content: Barstool produces a Sirius XM radio show (soon to be a whole channel), a growing list of podcasts and up to 90 blog posts a day. The dudes who make this stuff are uniformly young and white. In the three days I spent at Barstool headquarters, the only women I saw were Erika Nardini, the company’s chief executive; Asa Akira, the world-famous porn star who co-hosted a Barstool podcast; and the security guard.
2017-11-14.headline_main: Spurned by ESPN, Barstool Sports Is Staying on Offense

2017-11-14.abstract: A cranberry-lemon stripe cake, a devil’s-food cake with toasted-marshmallow frosting or a sugarplum gingerbread cake for your next special occasion.
2017-11-14.snippet: A cranberry-lemon stripe cake, a devil’s-food cake with toasted-marshmallow frosting or a sugarplum gingerbread cake for your next special occasion.
2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: Every family has its own sequence of nonnegotiable desserts during the holidays, and for mine, it’s a series of cakes. There is, without fail, a reliable slab of sticky toffee, packed with mashed, rehydrated dates, zapped under the broiler until its sauce of brown sugar and cream is bubbling furiously all along the top. My mother makes it, or I do, or my brother does. It doesn’t make a difference, because we all make it the same way. Then we eat it warm, with extra sauce on the side, picking back up on our endless conversation about the next day’s food plans, and the next day’s cake.
2017-11-14.headline_main: Three Gorgeous Cakes for the Holidays

2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: These days, big data, artificial intelligence and the tech platforms that put them to work have huge influence and power. Algorithms choose the information we see when we go online, the jobs we get, the colleges to which we’re admitted and the credit cards and insurance we are issued. It goes without saying that when computers are making decisions, a lot can go wrong.

2017-11-14.snippet: Looking for a political figure on the American scene to give conservatives hope.
2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: Can Trumpist ideas, populist and nationalist, survive the polarizing and thus-far stumbling presidency of Donald Trump? What is Trumpism after Trump, in domestic and foreign policy, and is it possible to imagine a new infrastructure that would champion populist and nationalist ideas within the party and make them something more than just angry anti-elitist gestures? Ross Douthat, a Times columnist, recently hosted a discussion of these questions with Henry Olsen, a senior fellow at the Ethics and Public Policy Center, and Daniel McCarthy, the editor of Modern Age and an editor at large of The American Conservative.
2017-11-14.headline_main: Can Trumpism Survive Trump?

2017-11-14.snippet: Leaders from state capitols, city halls and businesses have come to a climate meeting in Bonn to say America remains committed to the Paris accord.
2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: World leaders have been meeting in Bonn, Germany, since last week to discuss carrying out the 2015 Paris climate agreement. Sadly, though not unexpectedly, the White House and federal agencies have largely been absent from the negotiating table. But American leaders from state capitols, city halls and businesses across the country have shown up in force, and we have delivered a unified message to the world: American society remains committed to our pledge under the agreement.
2017-11-14.headline_main: The U.S. Is Tackling Global Warming, Even if Trump Isn’t

2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: When a Korean barbecue place wants to set itself apart from all the other Korean barbecue places, it has essentially three variables to play with: meat, heat and sides. (In this way it is similar to American barbecue, which it otherwise doesn’t resemble at all.) Cote, which has been wielding scissors and tongs on West 22nd Street since June, is resoundingly in the meat camp.
2017-11-14.headline_main: This May Be the Best Beef at Any Korean BBQ in New York

2017-11-14.abstract: So many of us come together to celebrate Thanksgiving, but the holiday means something different to everyone. Here are your stories.
2017-11-14.snippet: So many of us come together to celebrate Thanksgiving, but the holiday means something different to everyone. Here are your stories.
2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: So many of us come together to celebrate Thanksgiving, but the holiday means something different to everyone. We asked for a snapshot of your Thanksgiving — a story or a tradition or a dish that helps define your holiday, and hundreds of you responded. You shared funny stories, about the turkeys that were too big for your ovens. You shared tragic memories, about experiencing unbelievable heartache on a day that is supposed to bring people together. And you shared tales about overcoming hardship to create a memorable meal. Here are your stories; together, they help tell the story of the holiday itself.
2017-11-14.headline_main: A Thanksgiving Snapshot: Readers Share Their Holiday Stories

2017-11-14.abstract: On the South Side of Chicago and around the U.S., memorial T-shirts are a way to remember, to celebrate — and to indict.
2017-11-14.snippet: On the South Side of Chicago and around the U.S., memorial T-shirts are a way to remember, to celebrate — and to indict.
2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Quentin Harris lives in the Englewood neighborhood here, and each year he commissions designs by Big City Fashions as an instrumental part of the unending process of grieving his brother, Julian. When Julian was shot and killed, Mr. Harris was in prison, unable to attend the funeral. Now he wears a memorial shirt, a new one each year, for an annual celebration held in his brother’s honor.
2017-11-14.headline_main: Memorial T-Shirts Create a Little Justice, a Tiny Peace

2017-11-14.abstract: For the soccer-crazed country, it was perhaps the lowest point in 60 years — a humiliation, wrapped in a tragedy, enveloped in an apocalypse.
2017-11-14.snippet: For the soccer-crazed country, it was perhaps the lowest point in 60 years — a humiliation, wrapped in a tragedy, enveloped in an apocalypse.
2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: ROME — Many tragedies have befallen Italy in the last 60 years. Dozens of governments have collapsed. Earthquakes and terrorism have shaken cities. The French started adding cream to carbonara.
2017-11-14.headline_main: Italy Fails to Qualify for the World Cup, and a Nation Mourns

2017-11-14.abstract: Grieving over FaceTime while her new husband waits for his visa, a reader wonders if their love can withstand a devastating early loss.
2017-11-14.snippet: Grieving over FaceTime while her new husband waits for his visa, a reader wonders if their love can withstand a devastating early loss.
2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: The “Dear Sugars” podcast is an advice program hosted by Steve Almond and Cheryl Strayed. The audio contains more letters; submissions are welcome at dearsugars@nytimes.com. If you’re reading this on desktop, click the play button below to listen. Mobile readers can find “Dear Sugars” on the Podcasts app (iPhone and iPad) or Radio Public (Android and tablet).
2017-11-14.headline_main: We Lost Our Newborn Baby. Can This Marriage Survive?

2017-11-14.abstract: For Viet Thanh Nguyen, a member of a refugee family, preparing the holiday meal does not bring up warm and fuzzy memories.
2017-11-14.snippet: For Viet Thanh Nguyen, a member of a refugee family, preparing the holiday meal does not bring up warm and fuzzy memories.
2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: Being a father makes me re-evaluate everything, makes me wonder how I am shaping, deliberately and accidentally, a young human life. In sending my 2-year-old son to preschool (he is now 4), I worried about how his teachers and classmates would socialize him.
2017-11-14.headline_main: Feeling Conflicted on Thanksgiving

2017-11-14.abstract: Jurors told the judge they could not reach a consensus on Norman Seabrook’s guilt. The judge directed them to continue deliberating.
2017-11-14.snippet: Jurors told the judge they could not reach a consensus on Norman Seabrook’s guilt. The judge directed them to continue deliberating.
2017-11-14.lead_paragraph: The jurors deciding the fate of Norman Seabrook, the former head of New York City’s correction officers’ union, will be back deliberating on Wednesday, a day after they told the judge in the federal corruption case that they were deadlocked.
2017-11-14.headline_main: Divided Jury to Keep Deliberating in Case of Ex-Jail Officers’ Union Chief

2017-11-14.abstract: The Rangers have won six games in a row, and Shattenkirk, their prized free-agent acquisition, has eight points in those games.
2017-11-14.snippet: The Rangers have won six games in a row, and Shattenkirk, their prized free-agent acquisition, has eight points in those games.
