2017-11-28.headline_main: Canada Offers $85 Million to Victims of Its ‘Gay Purge,’ as Trudeau Apologizes

2017-11-28.abstract: Great reads around the web, from Tara Parker-Pope, Jon Pareles, John Branch and others.
2017-11-28.snippet: Great reads around the web, from Tara Parker-Pope, Jon Pareles, John Branch and others.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What We’re Reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.
2017-11-28.headline_main: What We’re Reading

2017-11-28.abstract: Nicole Kidman, Timothée Chalamet and Mary J. Blige were among the night’s winners.
2017-11-28.snippet: Nicole Kidman, Timothée Chalamet and Mary J. Blige were among the night’s winners.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: As award shows go, the IFP Gotham Awards doesn’t have the cachet or the glitz of the Oscars or the Golden Globes. It’s a bit scrappier than its better-funded brethren. But then, for a series of awards dedicated to independent film, that’s almost the point.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Award Season Kicks Off at Gotham Awards Ceremony

2017-11-28.abstract: It’s planning to end net neutrality while opposing the Time Warner and AT&T merger. This doesn’t make sense.
2017-11-28.snippet: It’s planning to end net neutrality while opposing the Time Warner and AT&T merger. This doesn’t make sense.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Peter Thiel, Facebook’s first outside investor, once wrote: “Competition is for losers. If you want to create and capture lasting value, look to build a monopoly.” Executives at Facebook, Google and Amazon seem to have taken his blunt advice.
2017-11-28.headline_main: The Trump Administration’s Incoherent Stance on Competition

2017-11-28.abstract: Ahmed Abu Khattala was the first person charged and prosecuted in the attacks in Benghazi, Libya, which left four Americans dead, including an ambassador.
2017-11-28.snippet: Ahmed Abu Khattala was the first person charged and prosecuted in the attacks in Benghazi, Libya, which left four Americans dead, including an ambassador.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A former militia leader from Libya was convicted on Tuesday of terrorism charges arising from the 2012 attacks in Benghazi, Libya, that killed a United States ambassador and three other Americans. But he was acquitted of multiple counts of the most serious offense, murder.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Libyan Convicted of Terrorism in Benghazi Attacks but Acquitted of Murder

2017-11-28.abstract: Steven Spielberg’s Pentagon Papers drama leads, as “Lady Bird,” “Get Out” and “Call Me by Your Name” gain momentum
2017-11-28.snippet: Steven Spielberg’s Pentagon Papers drama leads, as “Lady Bird,” “Get Out” and “Call Me by Your Name” gain momentum
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: After big wins at Monday night’s Gotham Awards, “Get Out,” “Lady Bird” and “Call Me by Your Name” picked up more awards season momentum on Tuesday, when the National Board of Review announced its top movies and performances of the year.
2017-11-28.headline_main: ‘The Post’ Lands Top National Board of Review Prizes

2017-11-28.abstract: For decades, the plan to reduce traffic by charging drivers in crowded zones in Manhattan has been revived again and again.
2017-11-28.snippet: For decades, the plan to reduce traffic by charging drivers in crowded zones in Manhattan has been revived again and again.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: It is the Lazarus of congestion plans: reduce traffic in New York City by charging drivers in crowded areas at peak traffic times.
2017-11-28.headline_main: New York’s Tilt Toward Congestion Pricing Was Years in the Making

2017-11-28.abstract: Under shareholder pressure, the European giant said it would halve its greenhouse-gas emissions by 2050 and increase investment in alternative fuels.
2017-11-28.snippet: Under shareholder pressure, the European giant said it would halve its greenhouse-gas emissions by 2050 and increase investment in alternative fuels.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Bowing to pressure from shareholders and the Paris international climate accord, Royal Dutch Shell pledged on Tuesday to increase its investment in renewable fuels and to cut its carbon emissions in half by 2050.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Shell, to Cut Carbon Output, Will Be Less of an Oil Company

2017-11-28.abstract: The adult website’s temporary storefront serves as a reminder of how sanitized the city has become since the lurid heyday of peep shows and sex shops.
2017-11-28.snippet: The adult website’s temporary storefront serves as a reminder of how sanitized the city has become since the lurid heyday of peep shows and sex shops.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: In today’s squeaky-clean version of New York City, there’s a dearth of smut. Crunched by restrictive regulations and eclipsed by the internet, the once-plentiful naughty bookstores are thin, and only a few peep shows remain.
2017-11-28.headline_main: At PornHub Pop-Up Shop, a Hint of New York’s Dirty Old Days

2017-11-28.abstract: A strong economy and faith in Germany’s political system soothe investors. But the country’s prosperity may mask challenges down the road.
2017-11-28.snippet: A strong economy and faith in Germany’s political system soothe investors. But the country’s prosperity may mask challenges down the road.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Europe over the past decade has endured government bond meltdowns, bank failures, right-wing populists and Brexit.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Why German Markets Aren’t Worried About Angela Merkel. Yet.

2017-11-28.abstract: SoftBank is offering to buy shares in Uber at a 30 percent markdown. Investors could cash out, but the promise of more could cloud their thinking.
2017-11-28.snippet: SoftBank is offering to buy shares in Uber at a 30 percent markdown. Investors could cash out, but the promise of more could cloud their thinking.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Uber’s early backers are on a collision course with their own greed. Japan’s SoftBank and allied investors want to buy roughly one-sixth of the bumptious ride-hailing firm. Existing owners can sell at a $48 billion valuation, or about 30 percent below what Uber garnered in its last round of fund-raising. Even with a markdown, investors could make many times their money. The promise of more, however risky, will cloud the thinking.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Uber Backers Face a Dilemma: To Sell or Not to Sell

2017-11-28.abstract: The breakout pop-soul and R&B singer was bursting with praise for his fellow nominees.
2017-11-28.snippet: The breakout pop-soul and R&B singer was bursting with praise for his fellow nominees.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Khalid, the breakout pop-soul and R&B singer, was not yet 16 when he tweeted a stray thought: “I want to go to the Grammys one day.” It was early 2014, and he didn’t even mean as an artist, let alone one who was nominated. “Just to watch, just to see,” he recalled on Tuesday of his mind-set then.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Khalid, the Teenager With 5 Grammy Nominations: ‘They Got It Right This Year’

2017-11-28.abstract: A federal judge denied an emergency request on behalf of an Obama-era holdover who disputed President Trump’s decision to appoint a new acting director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.
2017-11-28.snippet: A federal judge denied an emergency request on behalf of an Obama-era holdover who disputed President Trump’s decision to appoint a new acting director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s deregulation push got a boost after a federal judge denied an emergency request on behalf of an Obama-era holdover who disputed Mr. Trump’s decision to appoint a new acting director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, delivering a legal victory to the White House, which argued that the president had the authority to install a new leader.
2017-11-28.headline_main: President Wins Round in the Battle for the Consumer Bureau

2017-11-28.abstract: At a Supreme Court argument on Tuesday, the justices focused on a narrow definition of “whistle-blower” in the Dodd-Frank Act.
2017-11-28.snippet: At a Supreme Court argument on Tuesday, the justices focused on a narrow definition of “whistle-blower” in the Dodd-Frank Act.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court seemed ready on Tuesday to interpret a federal law protecting whistle-blowers narrowly, barring many retaliation suits from people who say they were fired for reporting wrongdoing. The plain words of the law, part of the Dodd-Frank Act, required that conclusion, justices across the ideological spectrum said.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Justices Seem Ready to Limit Whistle-Blower Protections

2017-11-28.abstract: The populist wave that threatened to engulf Western Europe has largely stalled, but varied forms of populism in the east still threaten to infect the bloc.
2017-11-28.snippet: The populist wave that threatened to engulf Western Europe has largely stalled, but varied forms of populism in the east still threaten to infect the bloc.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — The populist surge that threatened this year to engulf Western Europe and created existential worries for Brussels seems to have slowed, if not crested.
2017-11-28.headline_main: In Eastern Europe, Populism Lives, Widening a Split in the E.U.

2017-11-28.abstract: New York may not have needed a new luxury concept store, but the Webster is more than welcome.
2017-11-28.snippet: New York may not have needed a new luxury concept store, but the Webster is more than welcome.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: New York doesn’t need another luxury concept store, but the Webster, the new SoHo outpost of the Miami Beach shop, has a transportive concept of concept.
2017-11-28.headline_main: The Webster Takes New York

2017-11-28.abstract: Ms. Streisand takes her fans on a tour of the way she was in “Barbra: The Music … the Mem’ries … the Magic!”
2017-11-28.snippet: Ms. Streisand takes her fans on a tour of the way she was in “Barbra: The Music … the Mem’ries … the Magic!”
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Barbra Streisand, long a pop culture law unto herself, affects some winning modesty at the beginning of “Barbra: The Music … the Mem’ries … the Magic!,” a concert film now streaming on Netflix. After landing in Miami on a private jet, she enters the loading area of the American Airlines Arena and is shown to an ice cream truck. “What kind of tour has an ice cream truck?” Ms. Streisand asks in mock wonderment before deciding she’d like to sample the mocha java flavor.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Barbra Streisand’s Misty, Water-Colored Memories in a Netflix Concert Film

2017-11-28.abstract: The public hearing in West Virginia was a required step before undoing the Clean Power Plan. One expert said the venue “does not denote a keen interest in alternative views.”
2017-11-28.snippet: The public hearing in West Virginia was a required step before undoing the Clean Power Plan. One expert said the venue “does not denote a keen interest in alternative views.”
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Want the latest climate news in your inbox? You can sign up here to receive Climate Fwd:, our new email newsletter.
2017-11-28.headline_main: E.P.A. Heads to Coal Country to Hear Views on an Obama Climate Rule

2017-11-28.abstract: Rabbi Gillman sought new ways to talk about God, death and the afterlife. He also championed the ordination of women and gays.
2017-11-28.snippet: Rabbi Gillman sought new ways to talk about God, death and the afterlife. He also championed the ordination of women and gays.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Rabbi Neil Gillman, a Jewish theologian who gave aspiring rabbis and congregants in the Conservative movement new ways to talk about God, death and the afterlife, and who was an important advocate for the movement’s ordination of women and gays, died on Nov. 24 at his home in Manhattan. He was 84.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Rabbi Neil Gillman, Theologian of Conservative Judaism, Dies at 84

2017-11-28.abstract: Transit has been a boon for real estate, but a bust for riders who can’t afford rising rents near subways, and must endure hourslong commutes to work.
2017-11-28.snippet: Transit has been a boon for real estate, but a bust for riders who can’t afford rising rents near subways, and must endure hourslong commutes to work.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: In single potent strokes, the piston of mass transit drives the simultaneous creation of tremendous wealth and grinding hardship in New York. The distance between those two can be measured by the length of a morning’s commute.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Pushing New Yorkers Beyond the End of the Line

2017-11-28.abstract: Mr. Powell breezed through his Senate confirmation hearing. The prospect of stability after Janet Yellen departs will please the markets.
2017-11-28.snippet: Mr. Powell breezed through his Senate confirmation hearing. The prospect of stability after Janet Yellen departs will please the markets.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s pick to lead the Federal Reserve has put his mastery of the central banking arts on display. Jerome Powell breezed through his Senate confirmation hearing on Tuesday with Zen-like confidence. He dodged the debate on tax overhaul, kept comments about rate increases comments predictable, backed Fed independence and defended its review of bank rules.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Jerome Powell Shows Mastery of Central Bank Arts

2017-11-28.abstract: Ms. Neblett performed numerous roles over many years but may have drawn the most attention for one in New Orleans in which she shed her clothes.
2017-11-28.snippet: Ms. Neblett performed numerous roles over many years but may have drawn the most attention for one in New Orleans in which she shed her clothes.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Carol Neblett, a soprano who sang numerous roles at New York City Opera and the Metropolitan Opera, as well as one particularly attention-getting one in New Orleans that included full nudity, died on Nov. 23 at her home in Los Angeles. She was 71.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Carol Neblett, Soprano at the Met and City Opera, Dies at 71

2017-11-28.abstract: Scientists thought that invasive large snails spelled doom for endangered North American snail kites, until some of the birds started eating them.
2017-11-28.snippet: Scientists thought that invasive large snails spelled doom for endangered North American snail kites, until some of the birds started eating them.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Conservationists have been sounding the alarm over invasive species for years, warning of the damage they can cause to habitats and native animals. But in Florida, an invasive snail might be helping an endangered bird species come back from the brink, researchers say.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Things Looked Bleak Until These Birds Rapidly Evolved Bigger Beaks

2017-11-28.abstract: Driven to carve out a refuge for cleaning and carpentry.
2017-11-28.snippet: Driven to carve out a refuge for cleaning and carpentry.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:
2017-11-28.headline_main: Revenge of the Suburbs

2017-11-28.abstract: Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson was offended by accusations that he has hollowed out his department, even though he wants to cut its budget by a third.
2017-11-28.snippet: Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson was offended by accusations that he has hollowed out his department, even though he wants to cut its budget by a third.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson said Tuesday that he was offended that anyone would suggest he was hollowing out the State Department, but he also suggested that the department’s budget should be cut by about a third.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Tillerson Takes Offense at Claims of Hollowing Out State Department

2017-11-28.abstract: An anti-discrimination organization that has partnered with FIFA to control fan behavior at the World Cup has issued warnings to gay and transgender fans and people of certain races.
2017-11-28.snippet: An anti-discrimination organization that has partnered with FIFA to control fan behavior at the World Cup has issued warnings to gay and transgender fans and people of certain races.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: EINDHOVEN, the Netherlands — An anti-discrimination organization that has partnered with FIFA to control fan behavior at the World Cup has issued warnings to gay and transgender fans and people of certain races and ethnicities for next summer’s tournament, highlighting ongoing concerns about threats they may face in Russia.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Ahead of World Cup, Fans Are Warned About Homophobia and Racism in Russia

2017-11-28.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-11-28.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2017-11-28.headline_main: Senate, North Korea, Uber: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing

2017-11-28.abstract: Senate Republicans’ tax cut would not pay for itself, according to a new report by the nonpartisan Joint Committee on Taxation.
2017-11-28.snippet: Senate Republicans’ tax cut would not pay for itself, according to a new report by the nonpartisan Joint Committee on Taxation.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Senate Republicans’ tax cut would not pay for itself, according to a new report by the nonpartisan Joint Committee on Taxation.
2017-11-28.headline_main: The Senate’s Official Scorekeeper Says the Republican Tax Plan Would Add $1 Trillion to the Deficit

2017-11-28.abstract: The F.C.C. plan to scrap existing rules for internet delivery has set off heated debate, personal attacks and echoes of the 2016 election.
2017-11-28.snippet: The F.C.C. plan to scrap existing rules for internet delivery has set off heated debate, personal attacks and echoes of the 2016 election.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It usually doesn’t take much to get people on the internet worked up. To get them really worked up, make the topic internet regulation.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Net Neutrality Hits a Nerve, Eliciting Intense Reactions

2017-11-28.abstract: Critics of the agency are exaggerating when they say the agency is “completely unaccountable” and adds little to consumer protection.
2017-11-28.snippet: Critics of the agency are exaggerating when they say the agency is “completely unaccountable” and adds little to consumer protection.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Alongside a legal showdown over who will lead the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, the agency also faces renewed criticism — including from the official overseeing the bureau as the case is being considered.
2017-11-28.headline_main: Is the Consumer Bureau ‘Unaccountable’ and Ineffective?

2017-11-28.abstract: The latest ratings show that viewers are tuning out NBC’s fun-and-games approach and flocking to the politically engaged Stephen Colbert and Jimmy Kimmel.
2017-11-28.snippet: The latest ratings show that viewers are tuning out NBC’s fun-and-games approach and flocking to the politically engaged Stephen Colbert and Jimmy Kimmel.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Ten months after Inauguration Day, the trend is holding: For late-night hosts, being sharply critical of President Trump is a winning strategy. And that is bad news for “The Tonight Show.”
2017-11-28.headline_main: A Sharp Decline for Jimmy Fallon’s ‘Tonight Show’

2017-11-28.abstract: Eight of the animals were jailed for four days in Orai, India, as part of a cleanup campaign. Their crime: devouring expensive saplings.
2017-11-28.snippet: Eight of the animals were jailed for four days in Orai, India, as part of a cleanup campaign. Their crime: devouring expensive saplings.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — What happens in a northern Indian town when you rip up someone else’s plants and saunter away?
2017-11-28.headline_main: India’s Punishment for Plant-Eating Donkeys: Jail Time

2017-11-28.abstract: Stonney Rivers spent 20 years in prison for robbery before the governor of Washington State granted him clemency in 2015. Now, he may again be sentenced to life in prison.
2017-11-28.snippet: Stonney Rivers spent 20 years in prison for robbery before the governor of Washington State granted him clemency in 2015. Now, he may again be sentenced to life in prison.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Stonney Rivers walked out of the Cedar Creek Corrections Center in Littlerock, Wash., in January 2015 with a rare second chance. The governor had commuted the life sentence he received in 1996 after his sixth robbery conviction.
2017-11-28.headline_main: His Life Sentence for Robbery Was Commuted. Then, Police Say, He Killed Someone.

2017-11-28.abstract: For instance, India can teach us the power of digitized data.
2017-11-28.snippet: For instance, India can teach us the power of digitized data.
2017-11-28.lead_paragraph: Mumbai, INDIA — In a recent MSNBC interview I described President Trump as a “brain-eating disease.”
2017-11-28.headline_main: Forget Trump and Discover the World

2017-11-29.abstract: The play, about a married French diplomat who falls in love with a Chinese opera singer, saw a significant drop at the box office last week.
2017-11-29.snippet: The play, about a married French diplomat who falls in love with a Chinese opera singer, saw a significant drop at the box office last week.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: The Broadway revival of “M. Butterfly” will close Jan. 14, six weeks earlier than scheduled.
2017-11-29.headline_main: ‘M. Butterfly’ Broadway Revival Will Close in January

2017-11-29.abstract: Employees from the agency’s inspector general’s office wanted to modify and sell their own version of proprietary government software, according to investigators.
2017-11-29.snippet: Employees from the agency’s inspector general’s office wanted to modify and sell their own version of proprietary government software, according to investigators.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It was an audacious scheme: an attempted inside job at the office of a federal watchdog agency, where the cops, the authorities said, became the robbers.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Insiders Accused of Stealing Personal Data From Homeland Security

2017-11-29.abstract: Dragging its abysmal standards lower, it may throw more money at billionaires to win two crucial votes.
2017-11-29.snippet: Dragging its abysmal standards lower, it may throw more money at billionaires to win two crucial votes.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: This is how Senate Republicans compromise these days: They could make their enormously unpopular tax bill, which lavishes benefits on corporations and wealthy families, more generous to real estate tycoons and hedge fund billionaires to win over a couple of lawmakers who say the legislation doesn’t do enough for small businesses.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Senate Considers Making a Terrible Tax Bill Even Worse

2017-11-29.abstract: The City Council is expected to revise the threshold for a tax that one politician said is “stepping on the neck of small businesses.”
2017-11-29.snippet: The City Council is expected to revise the threshold for a tax that one politician said is “stepping on the neck of small businesses.”
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: New York is a booming city somehow plagued by vacant storefronts, pockmarks on the streetscape that are casualties of urban evolution: Higher rents are forcing smaller shops out of business, and in their place follow a series of ubiquitous banks, chain drugstores and coffee shops.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Tax Break Could Help Small Shops Survive Manhattan’s Rising Rents

2017-11-29.abstract: The Crimson Tide’s chances of making the national semifinals for the fourth straight year were dealt a blow following a loss to Auburn on Saturday.
2017-11-29.snippet: The Crimson Tide’s chances of making the national semifinals for the fourth straight year were dealt a blow following a loss to Auburn on Saturday.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: In its final rankings before the official bracket is set on Sunday, the College Football Playoff selection committee dropped Alabama (11-1) from No. 1 to No. 5 after it lost to Auburn on Saturday, 26-14, delivering a rebuke of the Crimson Tide for the lopsided defeat.
2017-11-29.headline_main: College Football Playoff Rankings: Alabama Falls Out of Top 4

2017-11-29.abstract: In less than two weeks, much of the government will run out of money, but a negotiating session at the White House on Tuesday blew up after President Trump attacked Democrats.
2017-11-29.snippet: In less than two weeks, much of the government will run out of money, but a negotiating session at the White House on Tuesday blew up after President Trump attacked Democrats.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Less than two weeks before much of the government runs out of money, President Trump on Tuesday escalated the threat of a shutdown, accusing Democratic congressional leaders of plotting to use their leverage to raise taxes and flood the country with undocumented immigrants.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Trump Feuds With Democrats Ahead of a Possible Government Shutdown

2017-11-29.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, November 29, 2017.
2017-11-29.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, November 29, 2017.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: “There’s no way we could survive if there were more fires than snakes.”
2017-11-29.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: A Scourge Slithers Across a City (and Up Its Toilets)

2017-11-29.abstract: The 40-year-old Beltran is a former Met and Yankee who, in recent seasons, emerged as a thoughtful elder statesman on the field and in the locker room.
2017-11-29.snippet: The 40-year-old Beltran is a former Met and Yankee who, in recent seasons, emerged as a thoughtful elder statesman on the field and in the locker room.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: The Yankees’ search for a new manager will resume on Wednesday when Carlos Beltran becomes the sixth candidate to be interviewed since the team decided not to bring back Joe Girardi for the 2018 season.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Carlos Beltran Is Next Up in the Yankees’ Search for a New Manager

2017-11-29.abstract: Mr. Scaramucci said he was stepping down to spare Tufts, his alma mater, unnecessary scrutiny. But he stood by his threat of legal action against a student journalist.
2017-11-29.snippet: Mr. Scaramucci said he was stepping down to spare Tufts, his alma mater, unnecessary scrutiny. But he stood by his threat of legal action against a student journalist.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Anthony Scaramucci, whose brief tenure last summer as White House communications director ended after a profane phone call to a New Yorker reporter, resigned on Tuesday from an advisory board at Tufts University after several weeks of conflict with students.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Anthony Scaramucci Quits Tufts Advisory Board After Tangling With Student Paper

2017-11-29.abstract: Republicans took a significant step forward on Tuesday when a key panel passed the $1.5 trillion tax cut, clearing the way for a full Senate vote later in the week.
2017-11-29.snippet: Republicans took a significant step forward on Tuesday when a key panel passed the $1.5 trillion tax cut, clearing the way for a full Senate vote later in the week.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Republicans took a significant step toward passing a sweeping tax overhaul on Tuesday, with a key panel giving its approval and several wavering senators indicating they would support the tax package, helping clear the way for full Senate consideration later this week.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Republicans Clear Major Hurdle as Tax Bill Advances

2017-11-29.abstract: The president’s changing story, which has stunned advisers, is part of a lifelong habit of attempting to create his own version of reality.
2017-11-29.snippet: The president’s changing story, which has stunned advisers, is part of a lifelong habit of attempting to create his own version of reality.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Shortly after his victory last year, Donald J. Trump began revisiting one of his deepest public humiliations: the infamous “Access Hollywood” tape of him making vulgar comments about women.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Trump Once Said the ‘Access Hollywood’ Tape Was Real. Now He’s Not Sure.

2017-11-29.abstract: Scratching my intellectual itch.
2017-11-29.snippet: Scratching my intellectual itch.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: OK, folks, this is basically to scratch my own intellectual itch — later this week Senate Republicans either will or won’t enact the biggest tax scam in history, and analysis won’t make any difference. But inspired by the Furman-Summers beatdown of Republican economists lending cover to disgusting dishonesty by their political masters, I found myself looking for a simple analytical representation of the effects of cutting corporate taxes. By simple, of course, I mean for economists: for anyone else this may as well have been written in cuneiform. You have been warned.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Incidence and Welfare Effects of Corporate Tax Cuts (Extremely Wonkish)

2017-11-29.abstract: Corruption should be prosecuted. But malleable criminal laws are being used to go after political rivals, and that is dangerous to democracy.
2017-11-29.snippet: Corruption should be prosecuted. But malleable criminal laws are being used to go after political rivals, and that is dangerous to democracy.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: We are surrounded on all sides by news of criminal investigations into politicians. Robert Mueller, the special counsel, has obtained an indictment relating to his investigation into possible collusion between the Trump campaign and the Russian government. Congressional committees are also investigating Russian meddling in the 2016 election. House Republicans have announced plans to look into the Obama administration’s handling of Hillary Clinton’s emails and its decision to give a Russian-controlled company, Uranium One, control of some American uranium reserves. Now the Justice Department is considering whether to appoint a special counsel in the uranium deal.
2017-11-29.headline_main: When Politics Is Criminalized

2017-11-29.abstract: Leaders of the mainline Senate Democrats and the breakaway Independent Democratic Conference agreed in principle to work together, but nothing is assured.
2017-11-29.snippet: Leaders of the mainline Senate Democrats and the breakaway Independent Democratic Conference agreed in principle to work together, but nothing is assured.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: ALBANY — There might kind of, sort of, be a possible deal to unite Democrats, and conceivably give them a majority, in the State Senate, pending just a few caveats: a pair of special elections, the party’s 2018 fortunes at the ballot box, and an ambivalent, politically polymorphous senator from Brooklyn and his obsession with school security.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Warring Democrats in New York Pledge a Truce, for Now

2017-11-29.abstract: I second Erik Agard’s emotion.
2017-11-29.snippet: I second Erik Agard’s emotion.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE — My first reaction upon filling in the first theme entry (18A) in Erik Agard’s puzzle was, “Hey! It’s the Supremes!” I know, the real answer did not refer to the award-winning singing group, but by the time I finished and got the revealer at 74A, I realized that it actually did.

2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: After nearly a year of the Trump presidency, do you regret your criticisms of Barack Obama? Oh, no. I told the truth. When I said drone strikes are crimes against humanity, when I said Obama bailed out Wall Street rather than Main Street — I shall forever support that. I was just speaking to the reality that people are hurting, and we have to do the same thing under Trump as we did under Obama.

2017-11-29.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on working for an employer with offensive views and dealing with a boyfriend’s restrictions on contacting an ex.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: I am a graduate student in a program designed to prepare you for a career working with rare books and manuscripts. I have a job as an assistant to an antiquarian bookseller. It is just the two of us, and he pays me very well, allows me to work the hours I want, gives me a good deal of responsibility and is willing to give me in-depth training. He is, however, racist, homophobic, transphobic, bigoted and sexist. I am very liberal and find his ideas on many subjects to be repugnant. Though I have asked that he not talk about politics when we are together, he still does so from time to time. I often just let him speak and barely engage; debating with him only riles him and puts me in a bad spot, because I depend on the salary to pay for school and rent.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Should I Keep Working for a Raging Bigot?

2017-11-29.abstract: El Salvador’s gangs try to negotiate a way out of their bloody stalemate with the police.
2017-11-29.snippet: El Salvador’s gangs try to negotiate a way out of their bloody stalemate with the police.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: In March 2016, President Salvador Sánchez Cerén of El Salvador announced a set of “extraordinary measures” that, he said, would put an end to the gangs that had made his nation the most homicidal place on Earth. A government-backed truce four years earlier had failed, and the death toll had climbed to 104 homicides per 100,000 people nationwide and nearly double that in the capital, San Salvador. Now, instead of supporting the truce, the ruling Farabundo Martí National Liberation Front, or F.M.L.N., would summon the mano dura — the iron fist. El Salvador’s armed forces would be deployed, its police emboldened, its prisons packed to overflowing.
2017-11-29.headline_main: ‘They Will Have to Answer to Us’

2017-11-29.abstract: Arguing, again, about whether racism or populism made Trump president.

2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: In a little known canto of Dante’s Purgatorio, the Florentine poet reaches Terrace 3½ of purgatory’s mountain, a strange space halfway up the path between the levels where the wrathful and the slothful endure their purification. There he finds the pundit class of the present-day United States, a tangle of arms and legs and laptops, with piteous cries and smug certainties rising in a chorus. Their task, imposed by the refining power of divine love, is to wrestle together until they reach consensus on whether it was racism or economic grievances that drove so many American voters into the arms of Donald Trump.

2017-11-29.abstract: There were many reasons we were honored to have The New York Times’s executive editor, Dean Baquet, interview our cover subject, Jay-Z.
2017-11-29.snippet: There were many reasons we were honored to have The New York Times’s executive editor, Dean Baquet, interview our cover subject, Jay-Z.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Anyone who’s ever read a profile, edited a profile or been the subject of a profile knows that the difference between a revelatory interview and a banal one depends almost as much — if not more so — on the interlocutor as on the subject. The interviewee — no matter how eloquent, insightful and generous he may be in life — is, in the moment he sits down, a cipher; the concern is that he will either say nothing at all, or, worse, say nothing of meaning: that he will become a persona, and that instead of conversation, what follows will be a kind of performance, a recitation of what he knows we have come to expect. A good interviewer, however, is able to transcend the inherent artificiality of the moment, to make the encounter feel less like testimony and more like a real dialogue (albeit one heavily weighted toward only one participant’s thoughts and opinions).
2017-11-29.headline_main: T’s Holiday Issue: Editor’s Letter

2017-11-29.snippet: Ivo van Hove’s hypnotic adaptation of Ayn Rand’s notorious 1943 novel speaks to the primitive narcissist in all of us. (Mr. Trump, are you listening?)
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: It is a continuing astonishment to many a sensible adult that anyone who survived adolescence takes Ayn Rand seriously. Yet admirers of this creator of fat, hyperventilating novels, which extolled “the virtue of selfishness” and the capitalist superhero, have filled conservative power lists for decades.

Here, the pop and jazz critics of The New York Times select notable releases, familiar and odd.

2017-11-29.snippet: On the follow-up to the 2014 album “Songs of Innocence,” the band sets out to counter the despair of 2017 with love and optimism.

2017-11-29.abstract: “The Butchering Art,” by the medical historian Lindsey Fitzharris, recounts how Joseph Lister and others introduced antiseptic practices to medicine.
2017-11-29.snippet: “The Butchering Art,” by the medical historian Lindsey Fitzharris, recounts how Joseph Lister and others introduced antiseptic practices to medicine.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Books about Victorian medicine are an acquired taste. They’re science by way of B-horror movies, tales of progress set amid blood and spatter and gray guts. To enjoy them requires a tolerance for ick, an enthusiasm for the macabre and (ideally) the iron discipline not to read before supper, especially if that supper is a nice steak.

2017-11-29.abstract: Though the sculpture emerged from the smoldering ruins largely intact and became a symbol of resilience, it was unwelcome at the memorial for years.
2017-11-29.snippet: Though the sculpture emerged from the smoldering ruins largely intact and became a symbol of resilience, it was unwelcome at the memorial for years.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: The memorial at Pearl Harbor captures terror and loss by allowing visitors to view the destroyed U.S.S. Arizona under the sea. The memorial at Hiroshima makes a statement about death and hope by preserving the ruins of a domed hall that stood at the atomic bomb’s hypocenter. But in New York, the 9/11 Memorial had no such authentic artifact on the site to remind visitors of the horror of the attack it commemorated.

2017-11-29.abstract: Taxing free tuition would harm all graduate students, but it would be devastating for students of color.

2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: While a House Republican proposal to tax the tuition waivers of graduate students may not be among the highest-profile Trump-era assaults on people of color, it represents a serious threat to racial equality. If included in the final tax plan, it would disproportionately harm nonwhite graduate students and be disastrous for the already dismal diversity of academia, putting an additional roadblock between people of color and the ivory tower and depriving all of us of their desperately needed intellectual contributions.

Zeldin after Mr. Zeldin, a Republican from Long Island, voted against the sweeping tax overhaul that cleared the House this month.

2017-11-29.abstract: Twelve years after being ordered deported, Jakiw Palij, 94, still lives in Queens and could remain there.
2017-11-29.snippet: Twelve years after being ordered deported, Jakiw Palij, 94, still lives in Queens and could remain there.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: When an international tribunal last week pronounced the former Serbian commander Gen. Ratko Mladic guilty of genocide and sentenced him to spend the rest of his days in prison, it reinforced a pillar of civilization: No crime against humanity, no matter how long ago it occurred, should be immune to cries for justice. And no criminal is too old to be deservedly punished.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Justice Long Delayed for Nazi Collaborator

2017-11-29.abstract: The 2018 drama reteams the director of “Lion” with that film’s co-star to tell the biblical story of Jesus’ follower.
2017-11-29.snippet: The 2018 drama reteams the director of “Lion” with that film’s co-star to tell the biblical story of Jesus’ follower.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: One year ago, Harvey Weinstein was waging what may have been his final Oscar campaign. It was for “Lion,” directed by Garth Davis and co-starring Rooney Mara, and the Weinstein Company mogul probably hoped to have another Academy Awards contender with a new film from the same team — the biblical biopic “Mary Magdalene.” The film was delayed until next year, but there’s a new trailer from its British distributor, Universal, to entice audiences now.
2017-11-29.headline_main: New Trailer: ‘Mary Magdalene,’ Starring Rooney Mara

2017-11-29.abstract: “I can’t be a disappointment,” the Spartans sophomore Cassius Winston says. So far, he‘s not. Michigan State is 5-1 and ranked No. 3.
2017-11-29.snippet: “I can’t be a disappointment,” the Spartans sophomore Cassius Winston says. So far, he‘s not. Michigan State is 5-1 and ranked No. 3.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Michigan State’s basketball coach, Tom Izzo, prefers honesty in its rawest and most brutal form. When Izzo rates talent, especially among his own ranks, he has never been one for hyperbole.
2017-11-29.headline_main: At Michigan State, Young Point Guard Is in the Driver’s Seat

2017-11-29.abstract: The Senate will now begin a period of debate before a final vote on the plan.
2017-11-29.snippet: The Senate will now begin a period of debate before a final vote on the plan.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: The Senate will now begin a period of debate before a final vote on the plan.
2017-11-29.headline_main: How Every Senator Voted to Begin Debate on the Tax Bill

2017-11-29.abstract: What looks fresh this season? Colors that are, shall we say, slightly off. Here’s how to wear them.
2017-11-29.snippet: What looks fresh this season? Colors that are, shall we say, slightly off. Here’s how to wear them.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Call it an antidote to millennial pink. This season, the more strange (and typically unloved) the color, the better. Burnt orange, mustard, muddy green — the coolest colors right now evoke musty basements not touched since the 1970s, garish wallpapers and mothy thrift shop finds. But in luxe fabrics and modern shapes, these pretty-ugly, and nostalgic, shades feel fresh.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Sick of Millennial Pink? Here’s the Cure

2017-11-29.abstract: A look at the clips retweeted by President Trump suggests that the events shown are more complex than first appears. Here is what we know about them.
2017-11-29.snippet: A look at the clips retweeted by President Trump suggests that the events shown are more complex than first appears. Here is what we know about them.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Early Wednesday morning, President Trump set off international outrage when he shared a series of videos depicting Muslims in a negative light.
2017-11-29.headline_main: The Stories Behind Three Anti-Muslim Videos Shared by Trump

2017-11-29.abstract: Companies are more susceptible than ever to our outrage and our moral suasion.
2017-11-29.snippet: Companies are more susceptible than ever to our outrage and our moral suasion.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Social media takes a lot of punches for enabling sexual harassment. But the past two months have shown that it has also provided consumers with an unprecedented power to make their market preferences heard loud and clear. And right now, the market is demanding that companies do something about sexual predators and pests in their midsts. The firing of Matt Lauer — the “Today” show star who reportedly commanded a salary of $25 million per year — by NBC News is just the latest example of a company moving swiftly to protect its brand in the face of sexual misconduct allegations.
2017-11-29.headline_main: NBC Didn’t Fire Matt Lauer. We Did.

2017-11-29.abstract: Assemblyman Steven T. McLaughlin, the newly elected executive of Rensselaer County, was found to have asked an Assembly aide for nude photos.
2017-11-29.snippet: Assemblyman Steven T. McLaughlin, the newly elected executive of Rensselaer County, was found to have asked an Assembly aide for nude photos.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: An upstate assemblyman was disciplined for sexual harassment on Wednesday, after an investigation by the Assembly’s ethics committee found he had asked a female Assembly staff member for naked pictures.
2017-11-29.headline_main: New York Assemblyman Is Disciplined for Sexual Harassment

2017-11-29.abstract: Brookfield Place opens a holiday lounge, Dita Von Teese is at Bergdorf, and more.
2017-11-29.snippet: Brookfield Place opens a holiday lounge, Dita Von Teese is at Bergdorf, and more.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: On Thursday, the British men’s wear label Thom Sweeney will open its first United States flagship. The cozy space will have a living room and bar area surrounded by tweaked tailoring options like a padded bomber with contrast sleeves ($2,275) and a suede field jacket ($3,380). At 362 West Broadway.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Everlane Opens Its First Store, and Other Holiday Treats

2017-11-29.abstract: With the Senate on track for a final vote later this week, Republican leaders were still working to secure the votes they need to pass their tax rewrite.
2017-11-29.snippet: With the Senate on track for a final vote later this week, Republican leaders were still working to secure the votes they need to pass their tax rewrite.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate moved closer to approving a sweeping overhaul of the tax code on Wednesday, voting to begin debate on the tax bill as Republican leaders continue trying to secure the votes for final passage.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Senate Votes to Begin Debate on Tax Overhaul

2017-11-29.abstract: Magpies will eat ticks that drain the blood from elks, but a scientist found it takes the right mix of elk-magpie personality for the relationship to work.
2017-11-29.snippet: Magpies will eat ticks that drain the blood from elks, but a scientist found it takes the right mix of elk-magpie personality for the relationship to work.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Chances are that’s a shy elk looking back at a bold magpie, in the photograph above.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Shy Elk and Bold Birds Become Partners in the Wilderness

2017-11-29.abstract: The rabbit — a territorial, adorable loner — owes its popularity to Beatrix Potter.
2017-11-29.snippet: The rabbit — a territorial, adorable loner — owes its popularity to Beatrix Potter.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: The eastern cottontail rabbit may be the cutest animal to make New York City its home. Perhaps it is the large, brown eyes, or the pert ears. Or perhaps the warm brown coat, or that snowball of a tail. The rabbit’s appeal may include all the above — or perhaps just homespun familiarity. The eastern cottontail has been a fixture since Peter Rabbit hopped out of Beatrix Potter’s imagination in a letter to her nanny’s sick son in 1893. Other rabbit lovers point to Thornton Burgess’s rabbit tales. And those with toddlers in the thrall of Christmas season eagerly revisit Emma Thompson’s more recent “Christmas Tale of Peter Rabbit.”
2017-11-29.headline_main: Here Comes Eastern Cottontail

2017-11-29.abstract: A poem about a literary outpost in Queens.
2017-11-29.snippet: A poem about a literary outpost in Queens.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:
2017-11-29.headline_main: Forest Hills Librarian

2017-11-29.abstract: The movie originally featured Kevin Spacey as J. Paul Getty. After sexual misconduct accusations against him, he was replaced and his scenes reshot.
2017-11-29.snippet: The movie originally featured Kevin Spacey as J. Paul Getty. After sexual misconduct accusations against him, he was replaced and his scenes reshot.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: It was a race against time: In 1973, the oil heir John Paul Getty III was kidnapped in Rome, and his mother scrambled to save him before the deadline for ransom passed.
2017-11-29.headline_main: New Trailer: ‘All the Money in the World,’ Now With Christopher Plummer

2017-11-29.abstract: He led the network’s highly profitable “Today” show for more than 20 years. Now, the show is in trouble — and the news division is under attack.
2017-11-29.snippet: He led the network’s highly profitable “Today” show for more than 20 years. Now, the show is in trouble — and the news division is under attack.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Even his co-hosts did not know until 4 a.m. on Wednesday, just hours before the official announcement, that Matt Lauer had been fired after a serious allegation of sexual misconduct. That was when the NBC News president, Noah Oppenheim, called two of his “Today” show anchors, Savannah Guthrie and Hoda Kotb.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Matt Lauer Firing Caps a Difficult Time at NBC News

2017-11-29.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2017-11-29.headline_main: Matt Lauer, Senate, Missiles: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing

2017-11-29.abstract: Write-in votes, a kind of protest against the listed candidates, soared in 2017 to more than 5,000, far higher than in recent mayoral elections.
2017-11-29.snippet: Write-in votes, a kind of protest against the listed candidates, soared in 2017 to more than 5,000, far higher than in recent mayoral elections.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: In an election year marked by lackluster campaigning and low turnout, one group of New York City voters came to the polls in droves: those seeking to lodge the futile and time-honored protest of writing in a candidate for mayor.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Despite Light Turnout, a Surge in Write-In Votes for Mayor

2017-11-29.abstract: Alex M. Azar II, President Trump’s nominee for health secretary, said at a hearing on Wednesday that he knew how to improve a system that made drugs unaffordable for some patients.
2017-11-29.snippet: Alex M. Azar II, President Trump’s nominee for health secretary, said at a hearing on Wednesday that he knew how to improve a system that made drugs unaffordable for some patients.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Alex M. Azar II, President Trump’s nominee for secretary of health and human services, said Wednesday that he would try to reduce the burden of high drug costs, but he largely absolved drug companies from blame, placing the responsibility on a system that encourages price increases on medicines.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Health Nominee Grilled on Commitment to Lower Drug Prices

2017-11-29.abstract: He spurned several job offers from Lyndon Johnson before finally accepting the role of White House gatekeeper, though without the chief of staff title.
2017-11-29.snippet: He spurned several job offers from Lyndon Johnson before finally accepting the role of White House gatekeeper, though without the chief of staff title.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: W. Marvin Watson, a World War II combat veteran who ran Lyndon B. Johnson’s White House with the protective instincts of a loyalist, the privileged power of a confidant and the efficiency of a drill sergeant, died on Sunday at his home in The Woodlands, Tex., near Houston. He was 93.
2017-11-29.headline_main: W. Marvin Watson, Johnson’s Unofficial Chief of Staff, Dies at 93

2017-11-29.abstract: This week’s newsletter features a contest, with international bragging rights as the prize.
2017-11-29.snippet: This week’s newsletter features a contest, with international bragging rights as the prize.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Damien Cave, our Australia bureau chief, shares insights on global news, local recommendations and feedback from readers in this weekly newsletter. To receive it in your inbox, sign up here.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Australia vs. Canada

2017-11-29.abstract: Critics say it would put the military beyond civilian oversight and remove the incentive for state and local leaders to build effective police forces.
2017-11-29.snippet: Critics say it would put the military beyond civilian oversight and remove the incentive for state and local leaders to build effective police forces.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — Mexican legislators are preparing to write the military’s role in the drug war into law, drawing fire from critics who say the legislation will keep soldiers on Mexico’s streets indefinitely and lead to the suspension of basic civil rights.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Mexico Bill Cements Military’s Crime-Fighting Role. Some Civilians Are Uneasy.

2017-11-29.abstract: Ahmed Shafik, who narrowly lost the 2012 election, released a video accusing the United Arab Emirates of preventing him from leaving the country to campaign again for the presidency.
2017-11-29.snippet: Ahmed Shafik, who narrowly lost the 2012 election, released a video accusing the United Arab Emirates of preventing him from leaving the country to campaign again for the presidency.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — The former Air Force general who narrowly lost Egypt’s only free presidential election said Wednesday that the leaders of the United Arab Emirates were preventing him from leaving their country, seeking to block him from running again against President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Ex-General Says U.A.E. Blocks His Return to Egypt to Run for President

2017-11-29.abstract: The House Judiciary Committee on Wednesday advanced legislation to mandate that all states must accept any other state’s concealed-carry gun permit.
2017-11-29.snippet: The House Judiciary Committee on Wednesday advanced legislation to mandate that all states must accept any other state’s concealed-carry gun permit.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Gun rights legislation that would allow concealed-carry permit holders from one state to legally carry their guns to any other state passed a key House panel along party lines on Wednesday and appeared to be headed for a vote on the floor of the House.
2017-11-29.headline_main: Bill Expanding Concealed-Carry Gun Rights Advances in House

2017-11-29.abstract: Britain First, which believes that white Christian civilization is under threat from Islam, had been marginal. Now it has gotten an unexpected lift from the White House.
2017-11-29.snippet: Britain First, which believes that white Christian civilization is under threat from Islam, had been marginal. Now it has gotten an unexpected lift from the White House.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: LONDON — She organized “Christian patrols,” marched with crosses through heavily Muslim neighborhoods and accosted veiled women to rail against Islam. She was barred from entering any mosque in England. She has been arrested several times, most recently this month, on charges of making threats and abusive remarks.
2017-11-29.headline_main: British Far-Right Group Exults Over Attention From Trump

2017-11-29.abstract: An overhaul championed by President Trump and Republican leaders could reshape health care, education and social services.
2017-11-29.snippet: An overhaul championed by President Trump and Republican leaders could reshape health care, education and social services.
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: The tax plan has been marketed by President Trump and Republican leaders as a straightforward if enormous rebate for the masses, a $1.5 trillion package of cuts to spur hiring and economic growth. But as the bill has been rushed through Congress with scant debate, its far broader ramifications have come into focus, revealing a catchall legislative creation that could reshape major areas of American life, from education to health care.
2017-11-29.headline_main: It Started as a Tax Cut. Now It Could Change American Life.

2017-11-29.abstract: Uber faces a slew of problems, but has yet to answer a basic question: Can it develop a sustainable business model?
2017-11-29.snippet: Uber faces a slew of problems, but has yet to answer a basic question: Can it develop a sustainable business model?
2017-11-29.lead_paragraph: Uber’s year of efficiency is backfiring. The ride-hailing app’s 2017 goal was to grow while minimizing subsidies and cash burn. Instead, losses accelerated by a third, to nearly $1.5 billion in the third quarter, from the previous three months. Uber faces a slew of problems, but has yet to answer a basic existential question: Can it develop a sustainable business model?
2017-11-29.headline_main: Uber’s Year of Backfires

2017-11-30.abstract: We have a failed strategy with a hopeless goal.
2017-11-30.snippet: We have a failed strategy with a hopeless goal.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: If there was a message in North Korea’s launch of a new missile capable of reaching anywhere in the United States, it was that America’s strategy toward that country is failing — and that war may be looming.
2017-11-30.headline_main: Are We Headed Toward a New Korean War?

2017-11-30.abstract: The internet retailer used an annual conference to show how machine learning will spur growth at Amazon Web Services, its most profitable business.
2017-11-30.snippet: The internet retailer used an annual conference to show how machine learning will spur growth at Amazon Web Services, its most profitable business.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — The holidays are a time when there are constant reminders of how much Amazon dominates online shopping — the boxes stacking up on front porches, for example.
2017-11-30.headline_main: Amazon Trumpets Its Cloud Lead With N.F.L. and Other Deals

2017-11-30.abstract: A proposal to create hundreds of new judgeships to undo President Barack Obama’s judicial legacy is wrongheaded and based on false assumptions.
2017-11-30.snippet: A proposal to create hundreds of new judgeships to undo President Barack Obama’s judicial legacy is wrongheaded and based on false assumptions.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. — A prominent conservative law professor, Steven Calabresi, and one of his former students recently published a proposal to expand the federal judiciary by creating hundreds of new judgeships. A founder and chairman of the Federalist Society (of which I have been a member since 1984), Professor Calabresi promoted his “judgeship bill” as a way of “undoing” President Barack Obama’s judicial legacy. But there is nothing conservative — or otherwise meritorious — about this proposal.
2017-11-30.headline_main: Conservatives Should Oppose Expanding the Federal Courts

2017-11-30.abstract: The F.B.I. director faced sharp questioning over an internal report that some have said called to mind the F.B.I.’s illegal spying on blacks during the civil rights movement.
2017-11-30.snippet: The F.B.I. director faced sharp questioning over an internal report that some have said called to mind the F.B.I.’s illegal spying on blacks during the civil rights movement.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Members of Congress confronted Christopher A. Wray, the F.B.I. director, on Wednesday over an F.B.I. intelligence report that said that black extremists were targeting law enforcement because of police abuses in minority communities.
2017-11-30.headline_main: Lawmakers Confront F.B.I. Director Over Report on Black Extremists

2017-11-30.abstract: After the league put together a plan to contribute to groups that aid African-American communities, Eric Reid of the 49ers said the league was “trying to buy an end to the protests.”
2017-11-30.snippet: After the league put together a plan to contribute to groups that aid African-American communities, Eric Reid of the 49ers said the league was “trying to buy an end to the protests.”
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: Three N.F.L. players who have been kneeling during the national anthem have questioned a tentative plan negotiated this week by the N.F.L. to donate millions of dollars to groups that aid African-American communities, calling it an effort by the league to get them to stop their protests.
2017-11-30.headline_main: Players Criticize N.F.L. Over Donation Proposal

2017-11-30.abstract: Augusta Savage’s sculpture “The Harp,” which was wrongly demolished, should be recreated, in all its glory.
2017-11-30.snippet: Augusta Savage’s sculpture “The Harp,” which was wrongly demolished, should be recreated, in all its glory.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: It’s heartening that so many Confederate statues are being taken down in the South. But that’s not enough. We must also restore pieces of our national heritage that were wrongly destroyed. First on the list should be “The Harp,” a magnificent work by the noted African-American sculptor Augusta Savage that was demolished at the closing of the 1939 World’s Fair in New York.
2017-11-30.headline_main: As Confederate Statues Fall, What Should Replace Them?

2017-11-30.abstract: This is no way to handle a complex piece of legislation, and the Republicans must know it.
2017-11-30.snippet: This is no way to handle a complex piece of legislation, and the Republicans must know it.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: As more senators show signs of sacrificing their principles and embracing the Republican tax bill for minor and nebulous concessions, it bears looking more closely at the process that produced this terrible legislation and some of its lesser-known provisions.
2017-11-30.headline_main: The Senate Is Rushing to Pass Its Tax Bill Because It Stinks

2017-11-30.abstract: A focus on nuclear deterrence would fall short of President Trump’s promises to finally “solve” the problem with North Korea.
2017-11-30.snippet: A focus on nuclear deterrence would fall short of President Trump’s promises to finally “solve” the problem with North Korea.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Defense Secretary Jim Mattis declared on Tuesday that North Korea now had the missile capability to “threaten everywhere in the world, basically,” he hinted at a long-running debate inside the United States government: Can the same strategy that worked against the Soviet Union — mutually assured destruction — also work against a far smaller adversary?
2017-11-30.headline_main: Washington Eyes a Cold War Strategy Against North Korea

2017-11-30.abstract: In a rambling speech in Missouri on Tuesday, President Trump criticized the rich and said the tax bill in Washington would not help people like him.
2017-11-30.snippet: In a rambling speech in Missouri on Tuesday, President Trump criticized the rich and said the tax bill in Washington would not help people like him.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: ST. CHARLES, Mo. — President Trump flew to Missouri on Wednesday to talk about tax cuts lifting Main Street and the middle class. But he kept getting sidetracked by repeating unfounded claims that the tax bill poised to pass the Senate would hurt rich people, himself included.
2017-11-30.headline_main: A ‘Main Street’ Tax Speech Becomes a Trump Riff on the Rich

2017-11-30.abstract: A long-awaited trade-theft trial between Waymo and Uber was delayed until next year so Waymo’s lawyers can examine evidence that surfaced in recent days.
2017-11-30.snippet: A long-awaited trade-theft trial between Waymo and Uber was delayed until next year so Waymo’s lawyers can examine evidence that surfaced in recent days.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The last-minute evidence quickly mounted. A letter and an email full of damning claims. Apps that sent self-destructing messages. A payment of $4.5 million to an employee who threatened to be a whistle-blower — and an additional $3 million to his lawyer.
2017-11-30.headline_main: Judge Tells Uber Lawyer: ‘It Looks Like You Covered This Up’

2017-11-30.abstract: United States officials weigh in on a dispute that could shape global trading — and the willingness of the United States to remain in the W.T.O.
2017-11-30.snippet: United States officials weigh in on a dispute that could shape global trading — and the willingness of the United States to remain in the W.T.O.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: The United States has filed arguments to the World Trade Organization in a looming dispute over China’s future in the international body, which could shape the global trading system for decades to come.
2017-11-30.headline_main: U.S. Joins Europe in Fighting China’s Future in W.T.O.

2017-11-30.abstract: Cases decided decades ago have set an absurdly high bar for workers bringing sexual harassment lawsuits.
2017-11-30.snippet: Cases decided decades ago have set an absurdly high bar for workers bringing sexual harassment lawsuits.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: In a case that went to federal court in the early 1990s, a woman presented evidence that her supervisor tried to kiss her on multiple occasions, placed “I love you” signs on her desk, called her a dumb blonde, put his hands on her shoulders and asked her out on dates. The trial court judge dismissed her suit, declaring that this conduct did not meet the threshold for sexual harassment, and the appeals court affirmed the dismissal.
2017-11-30.headline_main: Boss Grab Your Breasts? That’s Not (Legally) Harassment

2017-11-30.abstract: Argentina’s most high-profile human rights trial included testimony about the former military dictatorship’s practice of killing civilians by throwing them out of aircraft.
2017-11-30.snippet: Argentina’s most high-profile human rights trial included testimony about the former military dictatorship’s practice of killing civilians by throwing them out of aircraft.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES — Judges overseeing Argentina’s most high-profile human rights trial sentenced 29 former officials to life in prison on Wednesday, in a case that documented the former military dictatorship’s widespread practice of killing civilians by throwing them from aircraft.
2017-11-30.headline_main: 29 Argentines Sentenced to Life in Prison in ‘Death Flights’ Trial

2017-11-30.abstract: A scary ankle injury in the first quarter forced Porzingis out of the game, but Enes Kanter led the team to a blowout of the Miami Heat.
2017-11-30.snippet: A scary ankle injury in the first quarter forced Porzingis out of the game, but Enes Kanter led the team to a blowout of the Miami Heat.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: The Knicks seemed to hold their collective breath Wednesday night when Kristaps Porzingis went down with a scary ankle injury in the first quarter against Miami, but even with their star forward sidelined they went on to demolish the Heat, 115-86.
2017-11-30.headline_main: Kristaps Porzingis Exits With Injury, but Knicks Roll to Win

2017-11-30.abstract: The gold trader told jurors why he’s helping prosecutors: “Cooperation was the fastest way to accept responsibility and to get out of jail at once.”
2017-11-30.snippet: The gold trader told jurors why he’s helping prosecutors: “Cooperation was the fastest way to accept responsibility and to get out of jail at once.”
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: A gaunt man in tan jail clothes took the witness stand Wednesday and began testifying about how he had bribed a Turkish economy minister as part of a billion-dollar scheme to smuggle gold for oil in violation of United States sanctions on Iran.

2017-11-30.abstract: President Trump nominated Marvin Goodfriend, an economist at Carnegie Mellon University, to an open seat on the Federal Reserve’s board.
2017-11-30.snippet: President Trump nominated Marvin Goodfriend, an economist at Carnegie Mellon University, to an open seat on the Federal Reserve’s board.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: President Trump on Wednesday nominated Marvin Goodfriend, a leading critic of the Federal Reserve’s actions since the 2008 financial crisis, to serve on the Fed’s board of governors.
2017-11-30.headline_main: Trump Nominates Conservative Economist for Fed Board

2017-11-30.abstract: The brief interview focused on a meeting attended by a Russian ambassador and the incoming national security adviser, Michael Flynn, according to a person briefed on the investigation.
2017-11-30.snippet: The brief interview focused on a meeting attended by a Russian ambassador and the incoming national security adviser, Michael Flynn, according to a person briefed on the investigation.

Mueller III, the special counsel, and answered questions about a meeting with a Russian ambassador during the presidential transition, according to a person briefed on the investigation.

2017-11-30.snippet: What did Matt Lauer, Charlie Rose and Bill O’Reilly have in common? They were encouraged to be larger-than-life characters before their sudden falls.

2017-11-30.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, November 30, 2017.
2017-11-30.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, November 30, 2017.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: “When you put all these pieces together, what you’re left with is we are squandering a giant sum of money.”
2017-11-30.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: G.O.P. Tax Plan Could Reshape Life in the U.S.

2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: Comic plays on Broadway these days are generally either knockabout farces like “The Play That Goes Wrong” or repurposed stand-up routines like “Latin History for Morons.” Comedy of the type that sustained the commercial theater for decades — verbal and domestic, often involving Jews — has petered out as a genre. Not even Neil Simon can get a decent revival.

2017-11-30.abstract: In postwar Japan, a single-minded focus on rapid economic growth helped erode family ties. Now, a generation of elderly Japanese is dying alone.
2017-11-30.snippet: In postwar Japan, a single-minded focus on rapid economic growth helped erode family ties. Now, a generation of elderly Japanese is dying alone.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: TOKIWADAIRA, Japan — Cicadas, every Japanese schoolchild knows, lie underground for years before rising to the earth’s surface in summer. They climb up the nearest tree, where they cast off their shells and start their short second lives. During their few days among us, they mate, fly and cry. They cry until their bodies are found on the ground, twitching in their last moments, or on their backs with their legs pointing upward.
2017-11-30.headline_main: A Generation in Japan Faces a Lonely Death

2017-11-30.abstract: This season’s graphic novels run the gamut, from an emotional coming-out story to a fantastical journey into a world of strange peach people.
2017-11-30.snippet: This season’s graphic novels run the gamut, from an emotional coming-out story to a fantastical journey into a world of strange peach people.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: For 44 years, Ernie Bushmiller’s “Nancy” was the most meat-and-potatoes strip on the funnies page, a streamlined and glistening machine for delivering one dopey gag every day, no more and no less. “Dumb it down” was one of Bushmiller’s mottos; in practice, as Paul Karasik and Mark Newgarden point out, that meant applying the sizable arsenal of his craft to making sure every mark in each strip served its central joke. Their book HOW TO READ NANCY (Fantagraphics, paper, $29.99) is a comprehensive, scholarly and intensely goofy dissertation on a single daily “Nancy” strip from 1959, in which Nancy’s pal Sluggo is spritzing people with a water pistol and growling “draw, you varmint,” while she prepares to blast him with a garden hose.
2017-11-30.headline_main: The Latest in Graphic Novels

2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: One night in July, my mother was looking at a star that has existed for at least 20,000 years. Her job is to study how stars die — how they expand, then implode. 2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: In the early-morning hospital dimness, the man awoke to see a platoon of doctors surrounding his 14-year-old daughter’s bed. He could see her sitting up, mouth open, a glint of sweat on her cheeks and forehead. He could hear the rapid, ragged breaths, almost as if she had just run a race. She looked over to him. She was scared. And suddenly, so was he.
2017-11-30.headline_main: It Started as Sinus Headaches — But Things Got Deadly.

2017-11-30.abstract: Half a dozen books on sports range from champion athletes to the fans who adore them.
2017-11-30.snippet: Half a dozen books on sports range from champion athletes to the fans who adore them.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: Sports as escape has always been a myth, and I have never been reminded of that so clearly as I was recently before the singing of the national anthem at a marathon in the rural South, when the starter said that anyone who knelt was going to get a “butt whuppin’.” (I wondered especially how the African-American runners who had trained for months for the race felt about that jolly send-off.) Over the past month, I have steeped myself in some dozen new sports books, and all seemed, to varying degrees, to speak to the tenor of the times. Or maybe the tenor is sounding a note so long and shrill it seems like white noise in the background for everything.
2017-11-30.headline_main: From Politics to Scandals, Sports Seem to Speak to Our Times

2017-11-30.abstract: A range of new books offering advice to gardeners, hikers and amateur naturalists, with detours back to colonial America and even Middle-earth.
2017-11-30.snippet: A range of new books offering advice to gardeners, hikers and amateur naturalists, with detours back to colonial America and even Middle-earth.
2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: Maybe the vibe was in the air, during the anniversary of a long-ago summer of love, when I planted several irresistibly eccentric beauties. A nodding hippie of a plant, Datisca cannabina is a woody perennial with vaguely cannabislike foliage; it sports pendulous, shaggy, fragrant wands of flowers that set chains of love-bead seeds. It occurred to me that if I were gardening one toke over the state line, in Massachusetts instead of Rhode Island, I could have been digging the real thing. And just in time to help the bud tenders among us comes a weirdly fascinating volume, THE LEAFLY GUIDE TO CANNABIS: A Handbook for the Modern Consumer (Twelve, $27).
2017-11-30.headline_main: The Great Outdoors: From Your Backyard to a Garden in Japan

2017-11-30.abstract: After 11 weeks in detention, the unnamed suspect still has not appeared before a judge. The courts must move faster.

2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex. — The story has a Kafkaesque quality: For nearly two months, the United States government has refused to identify an American suspected of being an Islamic State fighter who is being detained in Iraq.

2017-11-30.lead_paragraph: Recently, I was sitting on my couch between two influential, Emmy-winning writers, one a man and one a woman. We were talking about consequences. The comedian Louis C.K.’s entire life seemed to have been canceled overnight. His movie wasn’t being released, and his representatives dropped him after five women accused him of sexual harassment, behavior he then admitted. In just the past week, more famous and admired men have lost their jobs for such behaviors. Enter Charlie Rose and Matt Lauer right behind him and then Garrison Keillor.
